There, they must infiltrate a sabacc tournament to unearth the Hutt crime lord and discover exactly what deal he struck with the Empire.

data.name: Credits
entries: {@b Original adventure written by Rodney Thompson}
Special thanks to [Mishy](https://www.gmbinder.com/profile/mishy) for SW5e statblock conversions.

Piloting: Your Intelligence (Piloting) check measures your ability to control vehicles, aircraft, and spaceships. Piloting governs your ability to maneuver through tight spaces and debris fields or dogfight with enemy craft.
{@homebrew A DnD5e character can count any proficiency in {@skill Vehicles (Land)} or {@skill Vehicles (Water)} as having proficiency in the Piloting skill.}
Technology: Your Intelligence (Technology) checks measure your ability to recall information about droids, vehicles, spaceships, aircraft, and computers, as well as your ability to interface with them. Technology can also be used to stabilize a droid or construct.
{@homebrew A DnD5e character should replace their {@skill Arcana} skill with the Technology skill when determining proficiency.}
Lore: Your Intelligence (Lore) check measures your ability to recall information about the Force, artifacts, histories, and religions.
{@homebrew A DnD5e character should replace their {@skill History} and/or {@skill Religion} skills with the Lore skill when determining proficiencies.}
Biochemist's Kit: A {@item Biochemist's Kit|sw5ephb} includes all of the necessary components to create and house standard adrenals, medpacs, and stimpacs.

items: {@b {@skill Investigation}}. Proficiency with a biochemist's kit allows you to unlock more information on {@skill Investigation} checks involving adrenals, medpacs, and stimpacs
{@b {@skill Perception}}. When you inspect an area for clues, proficiency with biochemist's kit grants additional insight into any chemicals or other substances that might have been used in the area.

Biochemist's Kit.name: Medpac Improvement
entries: Over the course of a short or long rest, you can make a DC 15 biochemist's kit check to temporarily improve the potency of one {@item medpac|sw5ephb}. To use this benefit, you must have a biochemist's kit with you, and the medpac must be within reach. If the medpac is consumed before the end of your next short or long rest, when a creature uses this medpac, they take the maximum instead of rolling.

Biochemist's Kit: {@homebrew A DnD5e character should replace their {@skill Herbalism Kit} skill proficiency with a Biochemist's Kit skill proficiency.}
Demolitions Kit: A {@item Demolitions Kit|sw5ephb} includes all of the necessary components to create, set, and disarm explosives. It contains a plastic face guard and heavy duty gloves, as well as precision cutting and gripping tools, and various common components of grenades and mines.

items: {@b {@skill Lore|sw5ephb}}. Your knowledge of explosives grants you insight when answering questions about the most effective explosives for a given task.
{@b {@skill Investigation} and {@skill Perception}}. You gain additional insight when looking for mines and charges, because you have learned a variety of common signs that betray their presence.

Demolitions Kit.name: Amplify Explosive
entries: Over the course of a short or long rest, you can make a DC 15 demolitions kit check to temporarily improve one grenade or mine. To use this benefit, you must have a demolitions kit with you, and the object must be within reach. If the explosive is detonated before the end of your next short or long rest, it deals bonus damage. This bonus is a die, with a maximum value equal to your proficiency bonus. If you have expertise in the tool, this die's maximum is instead equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

Demolitions Kit: {@homebrew A DnD5e character should replace their {@skill Alchemist's Supplies} skill proficiency with the Demolitions Kit skill proficiency.}
Mechanic's Kit: A {@item Mechanic's Kit|sw5ephb} contains all of the commonly required tools to make repairs on constructs, such as ships, speeders, and turrets. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to perform repairs or install ship upgrades.

items: {@b {@skill Lore|sw5ephb}}. Your skill allows you to more readily discern the make and model of vehicle and ship parts.
{@b {@skill Investigation}}. Your experience lets you more readily identify aftermarket modifications in vehicles and ships.
{@b {@skill Technology|sw5ephb}}. Your experience grants you greater insight when conducting repairs on ships or vehicles.

Mechanic's Kit.name: Quick Fixer
entries: When you are interrupted while you are conducting repairs on a vehicle or ship, reduce the required time by half as long as you are present during the entirety of the repairs.

Mechanic's Kit.caption: Sample Activities
rows: Restoring power to a damaged vehicle

Mechanic's Kit: {@homebrew A DnD5e character should replace their {@skill Tinker's Tools} skill proficiency with the Mechanic's Kit skill proficiency.}
Munitions Kit: A {@item Munitions Kit|sw5ephb} contains the necessary tools to create ammunition for blasters, as well as devices to hone lightweapons and vibroweapons.

Munitions Kit.name: Hone Weapon
entries: Over the course of a short or long rest, you can make a DC 15 munitions kit check to temporarily improve a blaster or vibroweapon. To use this benefit, you must have munitions kit with you, and the object must be within reach. On a success, once before your next short or long rest, a character wielding this weapon can gain a bonus to one weapon damage roll. This bonus is a die, with a maximum value equal to your proficiency bonus. If you have expertise in the tool, this die's maximum is instead equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

Munitions Kit: {@homebrew A DnD5e character should replace their {@skill Smith's Tools} skill proficiency with the Munitions Kit skill proficiency.}
Security Kit: A {@item Security Kit|sw5ephb} includes all of the necessary components to set or disarm locks and traps.

items: {@b {@skill Lore|sw5ephb}}. Your knowledge of traps grants you insight when answering questions about locations that are renowned for their traps.
{@b {@skill Investigation} and {@skill Perception}}. You gain additional insight when looking for traps, because you have learned a variety of common signs that betray their presence.

Security Kit.name: Set a Trap
entries: Just as you can disable traps, you can also set them. As part of a short rest, you can create a trap using items you have on hand. The total of your check becomes the DC for someone else’s attempt to discover or disable the trap. The trap deals damage appropriate to the materials used in crafting it (such as poison or a weapon) or damage equal to half the total of your check, whichever the DM deems appropriate.

Security Kit: {@homebrew A DnD5e character should consider replacing their proficiency with {@skill Thieves' Tools} with a proficiency with either a @{item Security Kit|sw5ephb}, {@item Slicer's Kit|sw5ephb}, or {@item Trapper's Kit|sw5ephb}.}
Slicer's Kit: A {@item Slicer's Kit|sw5ephb} includes all of the necessary components to interface with and disarm digital securities.

items: {@b {@skill Lore|sw5ephb}}. Your knowledge of digital securities grants you insight when answering questions about them.
{@b {@skill Investigation}}. You gain additional insight when looking for digital securities when using computers and terminals.
{@b {@skill Technology|sw5ephb}}. Your knowledge of common digital security types makes it easier for you to identify them.

Slicer's Kit: {@homebrew A DnD5e character should consider replacing their proficiency with {@skill Thieves' Tools} with a proficiency with either a @{item Security Kit|sw5ephb}, {@item Slicer's Kit|sw5ephb}, or {@item Trapper's Kit|sw5ephb}.}
Trapper's Kit: A {@item Trapper's Kit|sw5ephb} includes all of the necessary components to create, disarm, and disassemble traps.

{@homebrew A DnD5e character should consider replacing their proficiency with {@skill Thieves' Tools} with a proficiency with either a @{item Security Kit|sw5ephb}, {@item Slicer's Kit|sw5ephb}, or {@item Trapper's Kit|sw5ephb}.}

entries.name: Strength
entries: While wearing armor or wielding a shield with the strength property, your speed is reduced by 10 unless your Strength score meets or exceeds the strength number.

entries.name: Auto
entries: Weapons with the auto property can only fire in burst, penetrating, or rapid modes. If the weapon has any combination of burst, penetrating, and rapid modes, you choose which mode to use. You can only use one mode at a time.

entries.name: Biting
entries: This weapon's damage becomes acid. Additionally, when you would make a melee weapon attack with a weapon with the biting property, you can instead force the target to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your bonus to attacks with the weapon, or the biting number, whichever is lower). If you would have advantage on your attack roll, the creature instead has disadvantage on their saving throw, and if you would have disadvantage on your attack roll, the creature instead has advantage on their saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes normal weapon damage and is subjected to any additional effects that would occur on a hit, and the first attack it makes before the end of its next turn has disadvantage. If damage dealt by this weapon reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

entries.name: Bright
entries: This weapon's damage becomes fire, and its luminous property sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet while activated, instead of only dim light in a 5-foot radius. Additionally, when you would make a melee weapon attack with a weapon with the bright property, you can instead force the target to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your bonus to attacks with the weapon, or the bright number, whichever is lower). If you would have advantage on your attack roll, the creature instead has disadvantage on their saving throw, and if you would have disadvantage on your attack roll, the creature instead has advantage on their saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes normal weapon damage and is subjected to any additional effects that would occur on a hit, and the creature takes additional damage of the same type at the start of its next turn equal to your governing ability modifier.

entries.name: Bulky
entries: While wearing armor with the bulky property, you have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on sound.

entries.name: Brutal
entries: When you score a critical hit with a weapon with the brutal property, you roll a number of additional weapon damage dice equal to the brutal number.

entries.name: Burst
entries: When you would make a ranged weapon attack with a weapon with the burst property, you can instead spray a 10-foot-cube area within range with shots, consuming ammunition equal to the burst number. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your bonus to attacks with the weapon) or take the weapon's normal damage. Before you use the burst property, you can declare one creature that would be affected by it. If the creature fails its save, in addition to the weapon's normal damage, it is subjected to any additional effects that would occur on a hit. If the targeted area is beyond normal range but within long range, affected targets have advantage on the save.

entries.name: Corruption
entries: This weapon's damage becomes necrotic, and it loses the luminous property if it has it. Additionally, when you would make a melee weapon attack with a weapon with the corruption property, you can instead force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your bonus to attacks with the weapon, or the corruption number, whichever is lower). If you would have advantage on your attack roll, the creature instead has disadvantage on their saving throw, and if you would have disadvantage on your attack roll, the creature instead has advantage on their saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes normal weapon damage and is subjected to any additional effects that would occur on a hit, and the creature cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Defensive
entries: When you make your first attack on your turn with a weapon with the defensive property, you can choose to suffer a penalty to attack and damage rolls with that weapon up to the defensive number. If you do so, you gain the same bonus to AC. These effects last until the start of your next turn, as long as you're holding the weapon.

entries.name: Dexterity
entries: A weapon with the dexterity property requires more skill to control. While wielding it, you have disadvantage on attack rolls unless you meet the Dexterity requirement.

entries.name: Dire
entries: Before you make a weapon attack with a weapon with the dire property, you can choose to suffer a penalty to the attack roll up to the dire number. If you do so and you hit with it, you gain an equivalent bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Disarming
entries: When you score a critical hit with a weapon with the disarming property against a creature that is holding an object, you can attempt to disarm the target (no action required). If the target is no more than one size larger than you (your size or smaller if your weapon has the light property), it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your bonus to attacks with the weapon) or it drops an object of your choice at its feet.

entries.name: Disguised
entries: You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks made to hide the nature of a weapon with the disguised property.

entries.name: Disintegrate
entries: When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by a weapon with the disintegrate property, it must make a Constitution saving throw, DC equal to the disintegrate number. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

entries.name: Disruptive
entries: When a creature is forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration due to taking damage from a weapon with the disruptive property, the DC for the check equals 10 or the full damage taken, whichever number is higher, instead of only half.

entries.name: Double
entries: A weapon with the double property can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with Double-Weapon Fighting. See the rules for Double-Weapon Fighting in chapter 9.

entries.name: Finesse
entries: When making an attack with a weapon with the finesse property, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

entries.name: Fixed
entries: A weapon with the fixed property does not fill the hand, but you can't use the weapon while the hand is full. Additionally, you have a +10 bonus to ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon.

entries.name: Heavy
entries: When you hit with an attack roll using Strength with a weapon with the heavy property, you deal additional damage equal to half your Strength modifier (rounded up, minimum of +1).

entries.name: Hidden
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks made to conceal a weapon with the hidden property.

entries.name: Interlocking
entries: While wielding a weapon with the interlocking property, you can use your object interaction to detach the weapon into two separate weapons or reattach into a single weapon. While separated, each weapon has the same damage, damage type, combined value and weight, and properties (except for the double property) as the single weapon.

entries.name: Keen
entries: When you make a weapon attack with a weapon with the keen property, the critical hit range increases by an amount equal to the keen number.

entries.name: Light
entries: A weapon with the light property is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when engaging in Double- or Two-Weapon Fighting. See the rules for Double- and Two-Weapon Fighting in chapter 9.

entries.name: Luminous
entries: A weapon with the luminous property sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius while activated. Additionally, Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while the weapon is activated have disadvantage.

entries.name: Mighty
entries: When making an attack with a mighty weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

entries.name: Modal
entries: A weapon with the modal property can switch between modes. A list of weapons in parentheses appears with the property-the weapons between which an exotic weapon can be switched by using an object interaction.

entries.name: Neuralizing
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon with the neuralizing property, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw, DC equal to the neuralizing number. On a failed save, the creature takes an additional 1d4 psychic damage and becomes frightened of you until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Obtrusive
entries: While wielding a shield with the obtrusive property, you have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Penetrating
entries: When you would make a ranged weapon attack with a weapon with the penetrating property, you can instead attempt to penetrate and hit a creature behind the target, consuming ammunition equal to the penetrating number. Make an attack roll against the initial target. If the attack hits, there is a creature within 15 feet of that creature and directly behind it, and the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it also takes normal weapon damage.

entries.name: Piercing
entries: Before you make a weapon attack with a weapon with the piercing property, you can choose to gain a bonus to the attack roll up to the piercing number. If you do so and you hit with it, you suffer an equivalent penalty to the damage roll.

entries.name: Power Cell
entries: Weapons with the power cell property are fueled by power cells, which must be loaded in order to fire the weapon.

entries.name: Rapid
entries: When you would make a ranged weapon attack with a weapon with the rapid property, you can instead unload on a single target, consuming ammunition equal to the rapid number. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your bonus to attacks with the weapon). On a failed save, roll the weapon's damage dice twice and add them together, adding relevant modifiers as normal and subjecting the target to any additional effects that would occur on a hit. If the target is beyond normal range but within long range, it has advantage on the save.

entries.name: Reach
entries: A weapon with the reach property adds 5 feet to your reach with it.

entries.name: Returning
entries: When you throw a weapon with the returning property, it automatically returns to your hand after the attack is complete, whether you hit or miss.

entries.name: Shocking
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon with the shocking property, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw, DC equal to the shocking number. On a failed save, the creature takes an additional 1d4 lightning damage and becomes shocked until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Silent
entries: When you make a ranged weapon attack with a weapon with the silent property while hidden, it does not automatically reveal your presence. Make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check contested by your targets' Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check. On a success, you remain hidden.

entries.name: Slug Cartridge
entries: Weapons with the slug cartridge property fire slug cartridges, which must be loaded in order to fire the weapon.

entries.name: Smart
entries: This weapon ignores your Dexterity score and proficiency bonus. Two numbers appear in parentheses with the property—the first is the weapon's Dexterity score, and the second is the weapon's proficiency bonus. The weapon uses these values instead of yours when you make attack and damage rolls with it. If you lack proficiency with the weapon, the weapon does not benefit from its proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Sonorous
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon with the sonorous property, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw, DC equal to the sonorous number. On a failed save, the creature takes an additional 1d4 sonic damage and becomes deafened until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: A weapon with the special property has unusual rules governing its use, explained in the weapon's description (see "Special Weapons" later in this section).

entries.name: Specialized
entries: A weapon with the specialized property bypasses the base and cap of certain properties. Another weapon property in parentheses with the property-the weapon property that the exotic bypasses the base and cap for.

entries.name: Switch
entries: A weapon with the switch property can deal an alternate type of damage. A damage value appears in parentheses appears with the property-the damage when the weapon uses its alternate damage type. On your turn, you can use your object interaction to change the weapon's damage type.

entries.name: Thrown
entries: Weapons with the thrown property can be thrown to make a ranged attack. If the weapon would normally be used to make melee weapon attacks, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon.

entries.name: Two-Handed
entries: A weapon with the two-handed property requires two hands to use.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: A weapon with the versatile property can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Vicious
entries: Whenever you deal damage with a weapon with the vicious property and roll the maximum on a weapon damage die, you gain a bonus to damage equal to the vicious number.

entries.name: Strength
entries: A weapon with the strength property has a heavy kickback. While wielding it, you have disadvantage on attack rolls unless you meet the Strength requirement. If the weapon has the burst, penetrating, or rapid property, you must meet the Strength requirement to use this feature. If the weapon lacks the two-handed property, you can wield the weapon in two hands to temporarily reduce the strength number by one step (from 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If this would reduce the strength number below 11, you ignore it entirely.

entries.name: Absorptive
entries: When you are wearing armor or wielding a shield with the absorptive property, damage that you take from weapons is reduced by an amount equal to the absorptive number. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

entries.name: Agile
entries: While wearing armor or wielding a shield with the agile property, your Dexterity score becomes equal to the agile number. If your Dexterity is already equal to or greater than the agile number, it has no effect on you.

entries.name: Anchor
entries: A shield with the anchor property can be used to provide cover. As an action, you can anchor or recover the shield. While anchored, you gain no benefit from a shield, and it does not require the use of a hand. Instead, while anchored, a light shield provides one-quarter cover, a medium shield provides half cover, and a heavy shield provides three-quarters cover.

entries.name: Avoidant
entries: When wearing armor or wielding a shield with the avoidant property and a creature makes an attack against you, the critical hit range decreases by an amount equal to the avoidant number, to a minimum of 1.

entries.name: Barbed
entries: When you succeed on a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to initiate or maintain a grapple while wearing armor with the barbed property, the creature takes kinetic damage using the barbed damage (which appears in parentheses with the property) + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Charging
entries: When you take damage while wearing armor or wielding a shield with the charging property, you gain a charge. You can store a maximum number of charges equal to the charging number, and the charges last for 1 minute. The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack while you have charges, you deal additional damage of the same type as the weapon's damage equal to the number of charges stored, and the charges are expended.

entries.name: Concealing
entries: While wielding a shield with the concealing property, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Cumbersome
entries: While wearing armor or wielding a shield with the cumbersome property, your speed is reduced by 5.

entries.name: Gauntleted
entries: While wearing armor with the gauntleted property, your unarmed strikes deal kinetic damage using the gauntleted damage (which appears in parentheses with the property) + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Imbalanced
entries: When you are critically hit while wielding a shield with the imbalanced property, you can't take reactions until the start of your next turn, and you gain no AC benefit from your shield against the next attack against you before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Impermeable
entries: Armor with the impermeable property functions as an enviro-suit, flight suit, and water suit.

entries.name: Insulated
entries: When you make a saving throw against an effect that would deal ion or lightning damage while wearing armor or wielding a shield with the insulated property, you can treat a d20 roll of below the insulated number as the insulated number.

entries.name: Interlocking
entries: While wielding a shield with the interlocking property within 5 feet of a friendly creature who is also wielding a shield with the interlocking property, you can both use your reactions on either of your turns to interlock the shields. While interlocked, both creatures gain a bonus to AC equal to the interlocking number. If at any point the creatures are more than 5 feet from each other, the shields immediately de-interlock, and this effect ends.

entries.name: Lambent
entries: While wielding a shield with the lambent property, you can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate the shield's light. While active, the shield sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. Additionally, Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while the shield's light is active that rely on sight have disadvantage.

entries.name: Lightweight
entries: Armor and shields with the lightweight property have their weight reduced by half.

entries.name: Magnetic
entries: While you are wielding a shield with the magnetic property and a melee weapon attack misses you by an amount less than or equal to your bonus to AC from your shield, the attacking creature must make a Strength check, DC equal to the magnetic number. On a failed save, the creature's weapon adheres to the shield. As an action, a creature can repeat this check. On a success, the weapon is freed.

entries.name: Obscured
entries: While wearing armor or wielding a shield with the obscured property, electronic sensors and cameras have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks against you that rely on sight.

entries.name: Powered
entries: While wearing armor with the powered property, your Strength score becomes equal to the powered number. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the powered number, it has no effect on you.

entries.name: Reactive
entries: When you are wearing armor with the reactive property and a creature hits you with an attack roll, you gain a bonus to AC against the next attack from that creature before the start of your next turn equal to the reactive number.

entries.name: Regulated
entries: When you are wearing armor or wielding a shield with the regulated property and a creature rolls the maximum on a weapon damage die against you, they must reroll and use the new roll, even if the new roll is the maximum on the weapon damage die.

entries.name: Reinforced
entries: When you make a long jump while wearing armor with the reinforced property, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Responsive
entries: While you are wielding a shield with the responsive property and an attack misses you by an amount less than or equal to your bonus to AC from your shield, you gain a bonus to AC against the next attack from that creature before the start of your next turn equal to the responsive number.

entries.name: Rigid
entries: While wearing armor with the rigid property, you add half your Dexterity modifier (rounded down), instead of your full Dexterity modifier, to Dexterity saving throws you make. If your Dexterity modifier is negative, you instead subtract the full modifier.

entries.name: Silent
entries: While wearing armor with the silent property, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on sound.

entries.name: Spiked
entries: When you succeed on a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to shove or trip a creature while wielding a shield with the spiked property, the creature takes kinetic damage using the spiked damage (which appears in parentheses with the property) + your Strength modifier. If you use a shield with the spiked property as an improvised weapon, the damage increases by one step (from d4 to d6, d6 to d8, or d8 to 2d4).

entries.name: Steadfast
entries: While wearing armor or wielding a shield with the steadfast property, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws to avoid being moved.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: A shield with the versatile property can be used with one or two hands. While wielded in two hands, you gain an additional bonus to AC equal to the versatile number.

item.name: AB-75 Bo-Rifle
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, while it is in staff mode, the save DC for its shocking property increases to 15.
{@i This version of the bo-rifle was exclusive to high-ranking members of the Honor Guard of Lasan.}

item.name: ARC caster
entries: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon and roll the maximum on the weapon damage die, the creature hit becomes shocked until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk I
entries: This item gains the absorbing 2 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk II
entries: This item gains the absorbing 4 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk III
entries: This item gains the absorbing 6 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 6, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk IV
entries: This item gains the absorbing 8 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 8, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk V
entries: This item gains the absorbing 10 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 10, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Amplifier Mk VI
entries: This item gains the absorbing 12 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases to 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Adept)
entries: This item gains the absorbing 8 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 8, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Ancient)
entries: This item gains the absorbing 12 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases to 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Apprentice)
entries: This item gains the absorbing 4 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Journeyman)
entries: This item gains the absorbing 6 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 6, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Master)
entries: This item gains the absorbing 10 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 10, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorbing Conductor (Novice)
entries: This item gains the absorbing 2 property. If it already has the absorbing property, its absorbing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Absorptive Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the absorptive 1 property. If it already has the absorptive property, its absorptive property increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Absorptive Reinforcement Mk II
entries: This armor or shield gains the absorptive 2 property. If it already has the absorptive property, its absorptive number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Absorptive Reinforcement Mk III
entries: This armor or shield gains the absorptive 3 property. If it already has the absorptive property, its absorptive number increases to 3.

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Chipped)
entries: This item gains the accessing 2 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Cracked)
entries: This item gains the accessing 1 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Flawed)
entries: This item gains the accessing 3 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 3, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Flawless)
entries: This item gains the accessing 5 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 5, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Perfect)
entries: This item gains the accessing 6 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases to 6.

item.name: Accessing Cycler (Regular)
entries: This item gains the accessing 4 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Adequate)
entries: This item gains the accessing 2 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Excellent)
entries: This item gains the accessing 4 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Leading)
entries: This item gains the accessing 3 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 3, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Outstanding)
entries: This item gains the accessing 5 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 5, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Prime)
entries: This item gains the accessing 6 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases to 6.

item.name: Accessing Motherboard (Simple)
entries: This item gains the accessing 1 property. If it already has the accessing property, its accessing number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk I
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and a -1 penalty to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk II
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk III
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Accuracy Focus Mk IV
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Piloting}.

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Ace Pilot's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Piloting} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Acrobatics}.

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Acrobat's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Active Camouflage Core
entries: As an action, you can activate this augmentation to cast the {@spell infiltrate|sw5ephb} tech power targeting yourself. Intelligence is your tech casting ability for this power, and if you cast it using this augmentation, it does not require concentration.
{@b Side Effect:} While this augmentation is active, your speed is reduced by 10. Additionally, it fails to activate if you are submerged in water or other liquids.
{@i This internal augmentation can be activated to project a distortion field that bends visual light.}

item.name: Adapted Armor
entries: You have resistance to one type of damage while you wear this armor. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below.
{@i Those foolhardy enough to not treat a hostile planet as worthy a foe as the ones carrying blasters don't often live long enough to boast about it.}

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Chipped)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Cracked)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls and a -1 penalty to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Flawed)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Adegan Crystal (Regular)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk I
entries: This armor gains the agile 11 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by one step (from 11 to 13, 13 to 15, 15 to 17, 17 to 19, or 19 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the agile 13 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by two steps (from 11 to 15, 13 to 17, 15 to 19, or 17 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk III
entries: This armor gains the agile 15 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by three steps (from 11 to 17, 13 to 19, or 15 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk IV
entries: This armor gains the agile 17 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by four steps (from 11 to 19 or 13 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk V
entries: This armor gains the agile 19 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases by five steps (from 11 to 21).

item.name: Agile Armoring Mk VI
entries: This armor gains the agile 21 property. If it already has the agile property, its agile number increases to 21.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 10 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 60 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 50 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 20 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 30 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Alacrity Adrenal (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's speed increases by 40 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Ammo Pouch
entries: An ammo pouch is a small pouch, usually worn around the waist or chest, which holds 20 {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb|slug cartridges}. When you reload a weapon, you can draw as much ammunition needed from this pouch without using an object interaction to do so. Instead of {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb|slug cartridges}, you can instead store a {@item power cell|sw5ephb} which takes up the space of 10 cartridges.

item.name: Ammo-feed belt
entries: This belt has slots to hold 60 {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb|slug cartridges}, and can be connected to directly fuel a single blaster weapon that uses {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb|slug cartridges}. Once per turn, if the powered weapon would be reloaded, it can be done without using an action using any ammunition in the belt. Connecting or disconnecting a weapon takes an action. Replacing 10 {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb|slug cartridges} takes an action.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Basic)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls and a -1 penalty to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Improved)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Barrel (Superior)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Amplifying Channel (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 3 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases to 3.

item.name: Amplifying Channel (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 1 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Amplifying Channel (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 2 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Amplifying Processor (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 3 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases to 3.

item.name: Amplifying Processor (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 1 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Amplifying Processor (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the amplifying 2 property. If it already has the amplifying property, its amplifying number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Analysis Protocol
entries: You know the {@spell detect enhancement|sw5ephb} and {@spell toxin scan|sw5ephb} tech powers. You can cast each power once per day. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for these powers. You do not require use of a {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} for these powers.

item.name: Andris
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Fine)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d4} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (High Quality)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Potent)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d10} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Pure)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d12} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d12} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Andris (Uncut)
entries: Refined andris crystal, a spice mined most commonly on Sevarcos II, sharpens a creature's mind when smoked. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d6} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Animal Handling}.

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Animal Handler's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Antitoxkit
entries: An antitoxkit contained a variety of wide-spectrum antidote hypospray injectors that were designed to neutralize all known {@item poison|sw5ephb|poisons}. A kit has five charges. As an action, you can administer a charge of the kit to cure a target of one {@item poison|sw5ephb} affecting them or to give them advantage on saving throws against {@item poison|sw5ephb} for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to droids or constructs.

item.name: Aquatic rebreather
entries: Aquatic breathers are breath masks designed to operate underwater. While worn, the wearer can breathe both air and water.

item.name: Aratech Echo Belt
entries: While you wear this belt with its field on, Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide, as the belt funnels light around you. Activating or deactivating the belt takes an action.
{@i The success of this high-end stealth field generator emboldened Aratech to branch out into other hardware.}

item.name: Aratech Recycler Core Mk II
entries: When you use the burst feature of this weapon, you can choose to include up to 2 additional creatures within 5 feet of any affected space to also be affected the burst, if they were not already.

Once per turn, when you deal damage with this weapon, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn, and the damaged creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

item.name: Aratech Sound Dampening Boots
entries: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on moving silently.
{@i Before their repulsorcraft hit it big, Aratech honed its edge in the stealth field generator market.}

item.name: Armament and Defense Library
entries: You gain proficiency in all simple and martial weapons, all armor, and the {@skill Piloting} skill. Additionally, when you make an Intelligence check to recall or discern information about a weapon, piece of armor, or a military vehicle that this library contains information on, you are considered proficient in the check.

{@b Side Effect:} This aggressively effective library can make it difficult to focus in stressful situations. You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. Additionally, you have disadvantage on ability checks while concentrating on a power.

{@i This small and unassuming electronic module installed in the parietal lobe contains a massive library of information pertaining to weapons, armor, droids, and every other defense system known to the galaxy at large. Even rare or obscure pieces of technology are described here, offering a unique perspective on the universe - if you can handle it.}

item.name: Armor (Champion)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Additionally, while wearing this armor, damage you take is reduced by 2. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Armor (Exceptional)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Additionally, while wearing this armor, damage you take is reduced by 1. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Armor (Fine)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

item.name: Armor (Improved)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

item.name: Armor (Superior)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Armor Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable armor chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Arrow
entries: Arrows are ammunition used in bow weapons. When you would use {@item poison|sw5ephb} to coat a weapon or {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb}, you can instead coat an arrow with the {@item poison|sw5ephb}. Once a poisoned arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Arrow, Combustive
entries: A combustive arrow is a specialized {@item arrow|sw5eec} for use with bow weapons. When the arrow hits another creature, object, or surface it detonates. Each creature within 5ft of the arrow's detonation must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage. Once the arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Arrow, Electroshock
entries: An electroshock arrow is a specialized {@item arrow|sw5eec} for use with bow weapons. When you hit a creature with this arrow, the creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d3} ion damage and becomes {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. Once the arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Arrow, Noisemaker
entries: A noisemaker arrow is a specialized {@item arrow|sw5eec} for use with bow weapons. When the arrow hits another creature, object, or surface it generates an explosion of sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. If the target of the attack is a creature, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} sonic damage and is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. Once the arrow hits a target, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Artificially Intelligent
entries: You install an artificial intelligence into this armor. While wearing this armor, when you make an ability check, this armor's artificial intelligence can take the {@action Help} action.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses when you complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Assault armor
entries: Assault armor improved on {@item battle armor|sw5ephb}, with the benefit of micro-hydraulics that boost the efficacy of the operator. It offers better protection, but increased weight.

item.name: Atlatl
entries: This specialized gungan club can be used to throw grenades or similar objects at long distances. If you are wielding this weapon, as part of the action to throw a grenade, you can instead throw it using an atlatl you are holding. The grenade can be thrown at a short distance of 30ft and a long distance of 120ft. When throwing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion have advantage on the saving throw.  If you lack proficiency in the atlatl, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Atmospheric Decanting Vessel
entries: This metal jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds whether full or empty.

You can use an action and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterward, you can open the jug as an action and pour that liquid out, up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named.
Once the jug starts producing a liquid, it can't produce a different one, or more of one that has reached its maximum, until the next dawn.
{@i Most liquids one might desire curiously only involve a handful of elements. This device collects a reservoir of them to recreate a selection of such liquids on demand.}

item.name: Automated Adrenal Package
entries: Once on your turn, you can activate this implant to gain the effects of an adrenal (no action required). This effect lasts for one minute, or until a different adrenal is chosen. You can choose from the following types of adrenals:

items: {@b Strength Adrenal:} You gain a +1 bonus to the damage rolls of melee weapon attacks, and your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.
{@b Alacrity Adrenal:} You gain a +1 bonus to the damage rolls of ranged weapon attacks, and your speed increases by 10 feet.
{@b Stamina Adrenal:} You gain 2 temporary hit points and a +2 bonus to Constitution saving throws.

entries: {@b Side Effect:} You can no longer benefit from other adrenals.

{@i This clear plasti-polymer implant has an appearance vaguely resembling a multi-limbed cephalopod, and must be carefully installed by a master cybertech. It attaches by wrapping around the medulla, and produces a variety of combat adrenals for its user's consumption. It also performs blood-cleansing work to reduce the liver damage (for species that have a liver) caused by long-term adrenal use.}

item.name: Avoidant Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the avoidant 1 property. If it already has the avoidant property, its avoidant number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Avoidant Reinforcement Mk II
entries: This armor or shield gains the avoidant 2 property. If it already has the avoidant property, its avoidant number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Avoidant Reinforcement Mk III
entries: This armor or shield gains the avoidant 3 property. If it already has the avoidant property, its avoidant number increases to 3.

item.name: Avoidant Weave (Basic)
entries: This clothing gains the avoidant 1 armor property. If it already has the avoidant armor property, its avoidant number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Avoidant Weave (Choice)
entries: This clothing gains the avoidant 2 armor property. If it already has the avoidant armor property, its avoidant number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Avoidant Weave (Exquisite)
entries: This clothing gains the avoidant 3 armor property. If it already has the avoidant armor property, its avoidant number increases to 3.

item.name: Backpack
entries: A backpack stores 30 lb., not exceeding 1 cubic foot.

item.name: Balanced Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield loses the imbalanced property.

item.name: Ballistic Polymer
entries: While you have temporary hit points, kinetic and energy damage you take is reduced by an amount equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up).

item.name: Ballistic Polymer (Exceptional)
entries: While you have temporary hit points, kinetic and energy damage you take is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Bandolier
entries: A bandolier is worn across the chest. It has 12 pockets that can each hold a single item that weighs less than 2.00 lb, such as a {@item vibrodagger|sw5ephb}, a {@item Grenade, Fragmentation (Average)|sw5ewh|fragmentation grenade}, or a {@item power cell|sw5ephb}. Once per turn, drawing an item from a bandolier does not require your object interaction.

item.name: Bansche Advanced 2ZBc
entries: When you spend tech points and deal damage with a tech power cast through this {@item wristpad|sw5ephb}, you deal additional damage equal to the number of tech points spent.

item.name: Bansche Purifier MENAD Pro Mk I
entries: When you cast a tech power with this {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} that gives you a bonus to AC or saving throws, you can increase that bonus by +1.

item.name: Baragwin Stealth Unit
entries: While wearing this belt, you can turn on its stealth field to cause yourself to become {@condition invisible}. While you are {@condition invisible}, anything you are carrying or wearing is {@condition invisible} with you. You become visible when you turn off the field. Turning the field on or off requires an action.

Deduct the time you are {@condition invisible}, in increments of 1 minute, from the belt's maximum duration of 2 hours. After 2 hours of use, the belt ceases to function. For every uninterrupted period of 12 hours the belt goes unused, it regains 1 hour of use.
{@i Those Baragwin who sought to turn their telepathic empathy into an asset for bounty hunting needed something special to overcome the drawbacks of their lumbering frames.}

item.name: Barbed Armoring
entries: This armor gains the barbed ({@dice 1d4}) property. If it already has the barbed property, the barbed damage increases by one step (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d6}, or from {@dice d6} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Barbed Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the barbed ({@dice 1d6}) property. If it already has the barbed property, the barbed damage increases by two steps (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Barbed Armoring Mk III
entries: This armor gains the barbed ({@dice 1d8}) property. If it already has the barbed property, the barbed damage increases to {@dice d8}.

item.name: Battle Adrenal Mk I
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, when the target takes the {@action Attack} action, it can make one additional attack (no action required). This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Battle Adrenal Mk II
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, when the target takes the {@action Attack} action, it can make two additional attacks (no action required). This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Battle armor
entries: Battle armor is an armor that reduced weight, but restricts movement. The armor is commonly used by mercenaries, bounty hunters, soldiers, and civilians that live in dangerous areas.

item.name: Bayonet
entries: You affix a short blade to the barrel of this weapon, allowing you to make a melee weapon attack with it. The blade is a melee weapon with the finesse property that you are proficient with, and deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage.

item.name: Beemon Cardio-Regulator
entries: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this choker. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher.
{@i Demand for Beemon Laboratories' implants streches even to those too sickly to use them without assistance from another of their fine products.}

item.name: Berserker Defensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Berserker Instinct option.

item.name: Berserker Offensive Augment
entries: Your Rage damage bonus increases by 1, and when you score a critical hit, you can roll one additional weapon damage die and add the result to the total.

item.name: Binders
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 14 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. Breaking the binders requires a DC 20 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 20 Dexterity check. A set of binders comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 15 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 10 and 15 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Champion)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 24 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 30 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 30 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 30 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 15 and 90 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Exceptional)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 22 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 28 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 28 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 27 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 14 and 75 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Fine)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 22 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 22 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 18 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 11 and 30 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Improved)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 18 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 24 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 24 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 21 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 12 and 45 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Binders (Superior)
entries: Binders can be used to restrain a Small or Medium creature with appropriate appendages. Applying binders takes an action, and the target must make a DC 20 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). A hostile creature makes this save with advantage. A set of binders comes with one key. Breaking the binders requires a DC 26 Strength check. Escaping them requires a DC 26 Dexterity check. Without the key, unlocking the binders requires a DC 24 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. Binders have an AC of 13 and 60 hit points. Destroying the binders frees the creature without harming it.

item.name: Biochemist's kit
entries: Biochemist's kits are used to create and enhance medpacs and other healing implements.

item.name: Bioenhancement Matrix Mk I
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to your level, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

item.name: Bioenhancement Matrix Mk II
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level, and it increases by 2 every time you gain a level.

item.name: Bioenhancement Matrix Mk III
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to three times your level, and it increases by 3 every time you gain a level.

item.name: Biometric Safety Measures
entries: A security system is installed into the hilt of your lightweapon. When a creature other than you attempts to activate your lightweapon, the activation fails. Additionally, the creature attempting to activate it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage and is shocked until the end of its next turn. On a successful save the creature takes half damage and isn't shocked. On a success or failure, the creature then drops the weapon.

item.name: Bipod
entries: A bipod is a device mounted to a two-handed blaster that lacks the fixed property to offer increased stability while {@condition prone}. As an action, you can deploy or collapse the bipod. While deployed, you ignore the Strength requirement on the attached blaster with the strength property while you are {@condition prone}, and your speed is reduced to 0. Additionally, while deployed and {@condition prone}, you have a +10 bonus to ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of the weapon.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Adept)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 16 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Ancient)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 18 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases to 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Apprentice)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 14 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Journeyman)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 15 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Master)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 17 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Biting Crystal (Novice)
entries: This weapon gains the biting 13 property. If it already has the biting property, its biting number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Blaster Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable blaster chassis comes with vacant modification slots for blaster modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Blaster Integration
entries: You can now integrate a single simple or martial blaster into your droid chassis. Over the course of a short or long rest, you can insert and integrate this blaster into your frame. As a bonus action, you can open or close a small hatch located somewhere on your droid body, permitting you to wield and fire the weapon normally when you want to attack with it. While the hatch is open, your hands are not considered occupied by this blaster. All other rules and conditions apply normally as if you were wielding this blaster in either one or two hands (your choice).

item.name: Blaster cannon
entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the blaster cannon uses a specialized {@item power generator|sw5ewh} that allows it to fire continuously for 10 minutes. Replacing a {@item power generator|sw5ewh} takes an action.

Before firing the blaster cannon, you must deploy it using an action unless you meet its strength requirement. Alternatively, if you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this action replaces one of them.  While deployed in this way, you treat this weapon's strength number as two steps less (from 19 to 15), your speed is reduced by half, and you cannot fire this weapon at long range. You can collapse the blaster cannon as an action or bonus action.

item.name: Blueprint (Advanced)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of advanced rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 22 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Artifact)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of artifact rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 30 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Legendary)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of legendary rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 26 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Premium)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of premium rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 14 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Prototype)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of prototype rarity.
