Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 18 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Blueprint (Standard)
entries: This blueprint contains information regarding the raw and rare materials, tools, and steps required to craft an item of standard rarity. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, a character can attempt to learn the blueprint. If they do so, they must make a DC 10 Intelligence check with the appropriate tools. On a success, the blueprint for the item is learned. On a failure, the blueprint is not learned, and the character must wait 24 hours before they can try again.
{@i Blueprints contain the secrets of how to craft items of a more complex nature.}

item.name: Bo-rifle
entries: The bo-rifle is a lasat weapon most commonly carried by the Honor Guard of Lasan, which has the unique property of functioning as both a rifle and a staff. As a bonus action, you can switch between each mode, detailed below.
{@b {@i Rifle.}} While in this mode, the weapon uses traditional power cells.
{@b {@i Staff.}} While in this mode, the weapon gains the shocking property.

item.name: Bolas
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 10, 5 hit points, and immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Champion)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 15, 30 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Exceptional)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 17 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 14, 25 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Fine)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 14 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 11, 10 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Improved)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 15 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 12, 15 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolas (Superior)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 16 Dexterity check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The bolas has an AC of 13, 20 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the bolas frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the bolas's effects. While a creature is {@condition restrained} by a bolas, you can make no further attacks with it.
Due to their unwieldy nature, bolas make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Adept)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 8 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 8, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Ancient)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 12 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases to 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Apprentice)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 4 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 4, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Journeyman)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 6 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 6, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Master)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 10 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 10, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolstering Channel (Novice)
entries: This item gains the bolstering 2 property. If it already has the bolstering property, its bolstering number increases by 2, to a maximum of 12.

item.name: Bolt
entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the {@item bolt-thrower|sw5eec} fires specialized projectiles in the form of bolts.

item.name: Bolt, Deafening
entries: This {@item bolt-thrower|sw5eec} ammunition deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} sonic damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Bolt, Electrifying
entries: This {@item bolt-thrower|sw5eec} ammunition deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} lightning damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is shocked for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Bolt, Panic
entries: This {@item bolt-thrower|sw5eec} ammunition deals {@damage 2d6} kinetic damage on a hit. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} psychic damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. At the start of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Bolt-thrower
entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the bolt-thrower fires specialized projectiles in the form of {@item bolt|sw5eec|bolts}.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk I
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against melee attacks and a -1 penalty to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk II
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk III
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Bonded Plates Mk IV
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Bonded Weave (Basic)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against melee attacks and a -1 penalty to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this clothing.

item.name: Bonded Weave (Choice)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this clothing.

item.name: Bonded Weave (Favored)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this clothing.

item.name: Bonded Weave (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against melee attacks while wearing this clothing.

item.name: Boots of Bounding
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your fighter level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. On your turn, you can expend 1 or more charges to engage the rocket boosters and leap to a space you can see. For each charge spent, you can move up to 10 feet. Any opportunity attacks you provoke with this movement are made with disadvantage.

When you reach 5th level in fighter, when you use your Action Surge feature, your movement speed is doubled for the turn, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn, though you fall if you end your speed in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft, and opportunity attacks made against you this turn have disadvantage.
When you reach 11th level in fighter, when you use your Indomitable feature, you have advantage on the roll.
When you reach 17th level in fighter, once per round, when you miss with a weapon attack, you can repeat the attack (no action required).
{@i These red and black boots come with integrated rocket boosters.}

item.name: Boots of Hiding
entries: While wearing these boots, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track your steps.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to cause the boots to leave behind no footprints for 1 minute. When you do, another set of similar footprints appear on the ground that lead in random directions. These footprints last for 8 hours and travel up to 300 feet. A successful DC 14 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check reveals that the footprints are false. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Bottle
entries: A bottle stores 1 and 1/2 pints of liquid.

item.name: Brawny Arm Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces an arm.

When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength using only this arm, your Strength score is treated as 15. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength using more than just this arm, you take the average of the arm's Strength score and your own.
{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength with this arm, it seizes up, becoming unusable until the start of your next turn.
{@i These arm replacements are popular with the less exercise-inclined.}

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Athletics}.

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Brawny Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Athletics} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Bright Crystal (Adept)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 16 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Ancient)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 18 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases to 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Apprentice)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 14 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Journeyman)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 15 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Master)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 17 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Bright Crystal (Novice)
entries: This weapon gains the bright 13 property. If it already has the bright property, its bright number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Brutal Cell
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 1 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Cell (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 2 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Cell (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 3 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases to 3.

item.name: Brutal Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 1 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Oscillator (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 2 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Oscillator (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 3 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases to 3.

item.name: Brutal Scope
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 1 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Scope (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 2 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Brutal Scope (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the brutal 3 property. If it already has the brutal property, its brutal number increases to 3.

item.name: Bucket
entries: A bucket stores 3 gallons of liquid or 1/2 cubic foot of solids.

item.name: Burning Cell
entries: When you score a critical hit with this weapon, you have advantage on the next attack roll you make against that creature before the end of your next turn.

item.name: Burst Core
entries: This weapon gains the burst property, with a burst number equal to its reload number, minimum of 2. If it already has the burst property, the burst number is reduced to one-half its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Burst Core (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the burst property, with a burst number equal to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the burst property, the burst number is reduced to one-eighth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Burst Core (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the burst property, with a burst number equal to one-half its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the burst property, the burst number is reduced to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Byrothsis Adept Cell
entries: When this weapon is levitated by the Force to deal damage through a class feature or force power you use, it deals additional damage equal to one of its weapon damage dice.

item.name: Byrothsis Ancient Cell
entries: When this weapon is levitated by the Force to deal damage through a class feature or force power you use, it deals additional damage equal to two of its weapon damage dice.

item.name: CNS Strength Enhancer
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score becomes 23. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 23, it has no effect on you.
{@i This belt further increases a users physical power with pneumaticized assistance joists and a repulsorfield microgenerator.}

item.name: Camtono
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 15 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. It stores 5 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot, has an AC of 10, and 15 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Champion)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 30 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. It stores 10 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot, has an AC of 15, and 90 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Exceptional)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 27 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. It stores 9 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot, has an AC of 14, and 75 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Fine)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 18 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. It stores 6 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot, has an AC of 11, and 30 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Improved)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 21 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. It stores 7 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot, has an AC of 12, and 45 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Camtono (Superior)
entries: A camtono is a secured, handle container used for transporting valuable goods. A camtono comes with one key. Without the key, unlocking the camtono requires a DC 24 {@skill security kit|sw5ephb} check to force open. It stores 8 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot, has an AC of 13, and 60 hit points. Destroying the camtono risks damaging any goods stored inside.

item.name: Canteen
entries: A canteen stores 4 pints of liquid.

item.name: Cape of the Orator
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your scholar level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When your superiority die is rolled, you can expend one charge to reroll the die and choose either roll.

When you reach 5th level in scholar, you can maintain two targets of your Critical Analysis feature, instead of one. If you use your bonus action to analyze a third target, you choose which Critical Analysis ends.
When you reach 11th level in scholar, when you use your bonus action to use your Critical Analysis feature, you can target two creatures, instead of just one.
When you reach 17th level in scholar, you can take a third reaction each round. You can only take one reaction per turn.
{@i This color-shifting cloak is immune to wrinkles and always has a pressed appearance.}

item.name: Celerity Leg Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces both legs.

When determining your bonus to AC and saving throws from Dexterity, your Dexterity score is treated as 15. Additionally, you can substitute this score for your own whenever you make an ability check or attack roll that uses your legs. If your Dexterity score is already equal to or greater than 15, it has no effect on you.
{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity that involves these legs, they seize up, reducing your speed to 0 until the start of your next turn.
{@i This leg replacement is common for those travelers interested in making a quick getaway.}

item.name: Celerity Oscillator
entries: Once per turn, when you deal damage with this weapon, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn, and the damaged creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

item.name: Cesta
entries: This specialized gungan staff can be used to throw grenades or similar objects at long distances. If you are wielding this weapon, as part of the action to throw a grenade, you can instead throw it using a cesta you are holding. The grenade can be thrown at a short distance of 60ft and a long distance of 240ft. When throwing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. If you lack proficiency in the cesta, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Amplifier (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Channeling Rangefinder (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks and a -1 penalty to melee force attacks.

item.name: Charge, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: A device used to blow holes in larger constructs and structures, a charge creates a devastating explosion focused in a specific direction. Installing a charge takes 1 minute. The charge can be set with a 6-second timer, or detonated remotely using a {@item remote detonator|sw5ephb}.

When detonated, the charge explodes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d6} kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If affixed to a creature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw. Objects, structures, and other surfaces have disadvantage on the saving throw. If affixed to the object, structure, or surface, it instead automatically fails this saving throw.

item.name: Charge, Fragmentation (Deadly)
entries: A device used to blow holes in larger constructs and structures, a charge creates a devastating explosion focused in a specific direction. Installing a charge takes 1 minute. The charge can be set with a 6-second timer, or detonated remotely using a {@item remote detonator|sw5ephb}.

When detonated, the charge explodes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d10} kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If affixed to a creature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw. Objects, structures, and other surfaces have disadvantage on the saving throw. If affixed to the object, structure, or surface, it instead automatically fails this saving throw.
