item.name: Charge, fragmentation
entries: A device used to blow holes in larger constructs and structures, a breaching charge creates a devastating explosion focused in a specific direction. Installing a breaching charge takes 1 minute. The charge can be set with a 6-second timer, or detonated remotely using a {@item remote detonator|sw5ephb}.

When detonated, the breaching charge explodes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d4} kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If affixed to a creature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw. Objects, structures, and other surfaces have disadvantage on the saving throw. If affixed to the object, structure, or surface, it instead automatically fails this saving throw.

item.name: Charge, plasma
entries: A device used to blow holes in larger constructs and structures, a breaching charge creates a devastating explosion focused in a specific direction. Installing a breaching charge takes 1 minute. The charge can be set with a 6-second timer, or detonated remotely using a {@item remote detonator|sw5ephb}.

When detonated, the breaching charge explodes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d4} energy damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If affixed to a creature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw. Objects, structures, and other surfaces have disadvantage on the saving throw. If affixed to the object, structure, or surface, it instead automatically fails this saving throw.

item.name: Charging Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the charging 1 property. If it already has the charging property, its charging property increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Charging Reinforcement Mk II
entries: This armor or shield gains the charging 2 property. If it already has the charging property, its charging number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Charging Reinforcement Mk III
entries: This armor or shield gains the charging 3 property. If it already has the charging property, its charging number increases to 3.

item.name: Charisma Augment (Basic)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 1. One ability score other than Charisma (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Charisma Augment (Champion)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 2.

item.name: Charisma Augment (Exceptional)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Charisma Augment (Fine)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 1.

item.name: Charisma Augment (Improved)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. One ability score other than Charisma (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Charisma Augment (Superior)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Charisma Enhancement (Basic)
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Charisma (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Charisma Stim (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Charisma score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Charisma Stim (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Charisma score increases by 10, and its maximum for this score increases by 10. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Charisma Stim (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Charisma score increases by 8, and its maximum for this score increases by 8. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Charisma Stim (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Charisma score increases by 2, and its maximum for this score increases by 2. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Charisma Stim (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Charisma score increases by 4, and its maximum for this score increases by 4. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Charisma Stim (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Charisma score increases by 6, and its maximum for this score increases by 6. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Charisma Weave (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Charisma saving throws increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Charisma Weave (Exceptional)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Charisma saving throws increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Charisma Weave (Improved)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Charisma saving throws increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Charmer's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Persuasion} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Charmer's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Persuasion} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Charmer's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Persuasion} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Charmer's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Persuasion}.

item.name: Charmer's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Persuasion} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Charmer's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Persuasion} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Charming Noble Package
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Charisma saving throws.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score (other than Charisma) that is chosen by the DM when this augmentation is installed decreases by 1.
{@i This implant drastically increases your force of personality.}

item.name: Charric Pistol
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon. Additionally, it has the disarming property, and when a creature tries to reduce the damage of a shot from this weapon with a feature or power, such as monk's Deflect Missiles or the {@spell saber reflect|sw5ephb} force power, they have disadvantage on the reduction roll. Lastly, on a hit, if the target is wearing heavy armor, it deals an additional {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.
{@i The proprietary Charric pistol was the standard issue weapon of all of the soldiers in the Chiss Expansionary Defense Force.}

item.name: Charric Rifle
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon. Additionally, it has the disarming property, and when a creature tries to reduce the damage of a shot from this weapon with a feature or power, such as monk's Deflect Missiles or the {@spell saber reflect|sw5ephb} force power, they have disadvantage on the reduction roll. Lastly, on a hit, if the target is wearing heavy armor, it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.
{@i The proprietary Charric rifle was the standard issue weapon of all of the soldiers in the Chiss Expansionary Defense Force.}

item.name: Chest
entries: A chest stores 300 lb., not exceeding 12 cubic feet.

item.name: Chronometer
entries: A chronometer is a device that measures and keeps linear time.

item.name: Cilona
entries: Cilona, the active ingredient in deathsticks, is a hallucinogen that causes an ecstatic feeling that improves strength. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Cilona (Fine)
entries: Cilona, the active ingredient in deathsticks, is a hallucinogen that causes an ecstatic feeling that improves strength. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d4} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Cilona (High Quality)
entries: Cilona, the active ingredient in deathsticks, is a hallucinogen that causes an ecstatic feeling that improves strength. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Cilona (Potent)
entries: Cilona, the active ingredient in deathsticks, is a hallucinogen that causes an ecstatic feeling that improves strength. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d10} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Cilona (Pure)
entries: Cilona, the active ingredient in deathsticks, is a hallucinogen that causes an ecstatic feeling that improves strength. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d12} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d12} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Cilona (Uncut)
entries: Cilona, the active ingredient in deathsticks, is a hallucinogen that causes an ecstatic feeling that improves strength. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d6} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Circlet of Persistence
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your consular level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you would use a Force-Empowered Casting option, you can expend charges instead of force points.
When you reach 5th level in consular, when you use your Force Recovery feature, you can add both your Wisdom and Charisma modifier to the number of force points regained, instead of just one.
When you reach 11th level in consular, you can ignore the prerequisites for force powers that are lower level than your Max Power Level.

When you reach 17th level in consular, when you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a force power, you can add your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice, minimum of one) if it doesn't already include that modifier.
{@i This platinum circlet contains a gem that shifts colors at the whim of its bearer.}

item.name: Clandestine Stitching (Basic)
entries: This article of clothing come with one hidden pocket, which can store up to 1 lb. Finding this hidden pocket requires a DC 15 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clandestine Stitching (Champion)
entries: This article of clothing come with six hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 30 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clandestine Stitching (Exceptional)
entries: This article of clothing come with five hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 27 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clandestine Stitching (Fine)
entries: This article of clothing come with two hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 18 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clandestine Stitching (Improved)
entries: This article of clothing come with three hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 21 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clandestine Stitching (Superior)
entries: This article of clothing come with four hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 24 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Cloak Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Cloak Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Cloak Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Cloak Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Cloak Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Cloak Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Clothes, Clandestine (Champion)
entries: These clothes come with nine hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 30 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clothes, Clandestine (Exceptional)
entries: These clothes come with eight hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 27 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clothes, Clandestine (Fine)
entries: These clothes come with three hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 18 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clothes, Clandestine (Improved)
entries: These clothes come with five hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 21 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clothes, Clandestine (Superior)
entries: These clothes come with six hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 24 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Clothes, clandestine
entries: These clothes come with two hidden pockets, each of which can store up to 1.00 lb. Finding these hidden pockets requires a DC 15 {@skill Investigation} check.

item.name: Code cylinder
entries: Code cylinders are security devices in the shape of short cylinders that contain coded information about their bearers and grant them access to secure areas.

item.name: Collapsible Frame
entries: This weapon gains the hidden property.

item.name: Collapsible Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the hidden property.

item.name: Collapsible Stock
entries: This weapon gains the hidden property.

item.name: Collapsible Suit
entries: This armor can collapse into a case for easy storage. When transformed this way the armor is indistinguishable from a normal case and weighs 1/3 its normal weight. As an action you can don or doff the armor, allowing it to transform as needed.

item.name: Combat suit
entries: Combat suits are seen all over the galaxy, and can be found for sale by almost any merchant who dealt in weapons and armor. Many such suits are used by military organizations, such as the Galactic Republic's military, as well as by mercenaries, criminals, bounty hunters and even some Jedi.
The suit itself offers decent protection from most types of attacks while maintaining maximum flexibility and minimum weight. However this armor is only recommended for light skirmishes.

item.name: Comfortable Handle
entries: This weapon gains the finesse property.

item.name: Comm jammer
entries: A device used to scramble and block transmissions from communications devices in a 300 foot radius. The device can be activated or deactivated as an action. Any creature sending incoming or outgoing communications within range must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Technology}) check. On a failure, their communications are jammed until the comm jammer is deactivated or they move out of its range. The comm jammer lasts for 1 hour and can be recharged by connecting to a power source or by replacing the {@item power cell|sw5ephb}.

item.name: Commlink
entries: Commlinks are simple handheld communication devices, fitted with microphones and receivers. Basic, personal commlinks have a range of up to 30 miles, but are reduced in dense, urban areas or areas of high level interference. The commlink lasts for 10 hours and can be recharged by connecting to a power source or by replacing the {@item power cell|sw5ephb}.

item.name: Commlink, hands-free
entries: A hands-free {@item commlink|sw5ephb} functions as a {@item commlink|sw5ephb}, but can be installed in a helmet or worn independently, such as on your head or ear.

item.name: Compensating Attachment
entries: This weapon loses the two-handed property.

item.name: Compensation Oscillator
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the dexterity number is 11, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Compensation Oscillator (Champion)
entries: This weapon loses the dexterity property.

item.name: Compensation Oscillator (Exceptional)
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the dexterity number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Compensation Oscillator (Fine)
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the dexterity number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Compensation Oscillator (Improved)
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the dexterity number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Compensation Oscillator (Superior)
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the dexterity number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Composite armor
entries: Composite armor is a type of armored suit that offers a good balance of mobility and protection against most types of weapons. The micro-hydraulics of this type of powered armor provide the operator with protection, but are more bulky than mesh or {@item weave armor|sw5ephb|weave armors}. This type of armor is rarely seen outside of professional mercenaries' and soldiers' use.

item.name: Compound bow
entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the compound bow fires specialized projectiles in the form of {@item arrow|sw5eec|arrows}. You can make a ranged weapon attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one {@item arrow|sw5eec}.

Drawing the ammunition from a {@item quiver|sw5eec}, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

item.name: Computer Spike (Champion)
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check, and then you can reroll both of the dice once. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Computer Spike (Fine)
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Computer Spike (Superior)
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check, and then you can reroll one of the dice once. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Computer spike
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb}) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to reroll the check. You must use the new roll. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Concealing Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the concealing property.

item.name: Constitution Augment (Basic)
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1. One ability score other than Constitution (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Constitution Augment (Champion)
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 2.

item.name: Constitution Augment (Exceptional)
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Constitution Augment (Fine)
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1.

item.name: Constitution Augment (Improved)
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. One ability score other than Constitution (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Constitution Augment (Superior)
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Constitution Dataport (Basic)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the constitution number is 11, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Dataport (Champion)
entries: This item loses the constitution property.

item.name: Constitution Dataport (Exceptional)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the constitution number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Dataport (Fine)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the constitution number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Dataport (Improved)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the constitution number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Dataport (Superior)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the constitution number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Emitter (Basic)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the constitution number is 11, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Emitter (Champion)
entries: This item loses the constitution property.

item.name: Constitution Emitter (Exceptional)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the constitution number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Emitter (Fine)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the constitution number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Emitter (Improved)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the constitution number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Emitter (Superior)
entries: This item's constitution number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the constitution number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the constitution property from it entirely.

item.name: Constitution Enhancement (Basic)
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Constitution (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Constitution Stim (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Constitution Stim (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Constitution score increases by 10, and its maximum for this score increases by 10. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Constitution Stim (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Constitution score increases by 8, and its maximum for this score increases by 8. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Constitution Stim (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Constitution score increases by 2, and its maximum for this score increases by 2. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Constitution Stim (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Constitution score increases by 4, and its maximum for this score increases by 4. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Constitution Stim (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Constitution score increases by 6, and its maximum for this score increases by 6. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Constitution Weave (Champion)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Constitution saving throws increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Constitution Weave (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Constitution saving throws increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Constitution Weave (Superior)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Constitution saving throws increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Consular Defensive Augment
entries: When you roll initiative and have no uses of your Force Shield left, you regain one use.

item.name: Consular Offensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Force-Empowered Casting option.

item.name: Contoured Grip (Basic)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and a -1 penalty to damage rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Contoured Grip (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Contoured Grip (Improved)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Contoured Grip (Superior)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

item.name: Convenience Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield loses the cumbersome property.

item.name: Corellian Crippler Matrix
entries: Once per round, when you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this weapon, its speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Corrosive Cartridge (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d8} acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the loaded weapon, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Corrosive Cartridge (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d8} acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the loaded weapon, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Corrosive Cartridge (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d12} acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the loaded weapon, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Corrosive Cartridge (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d10} acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the loaded weapon, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Corrosive Cartridge (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item corrosive cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d8} acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the loaded weapon, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Corrosive cartridge
entries: A corrosive cartridge is a specialized {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb} for use with blaster weapons that deal kinetic damage. When you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d8} acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the loaded weapon, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Corruption Crystal (Adept)
entries: This weapon gains the corruption 16 property. If it already has the corruption property, its corruption number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Corruption Crystal (Ancient)
entries: This weapon gains the corruption 18 property. If it already has the corruption property, its corruption number increases to 18.

item.name: Corruption Crystal (Apprentice)
entries: This weapon gains the corruption 14 property. If it already has the corruption property, its corruption number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Corruption Crystal (Journeyman)
entries: This weapon gains the corruption 15 property. If it already has the corruption property, its corruption number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Corruption Crystal (Master)
entries: This weapon gains the corruption 17 property. If it already has the corruption property, its corruption number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Corruption Crystal (Novice)
entries: This weapon gains the corruption 13 property. If it already has the corruption property, its corruption number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Cortosis Weave
entries: This armor or shield gains the absorptive 1 property. If it already has the absorptive property, its absorptive property increases by 1, to a maximum of 3. Additionally, when taking energy damage from a lightweapon, this armor or shield's absorptive number is doubled, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Cortosis Weave (Exceptional)
entries: This armor or shield gains the absorptive 2 property. If it already has the absorptive property, its absorptive property increases by 2, to a maximum of 3. Additionally, when taking energy damage from a lightweapon, this armor or shield's absorptive number is doubled, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Cowl of the Professional
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your operative level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you deal Sneak Attack damage, you can spend charges to reroll any number of dice and use either result.

When you reach 5th level in operative, while the hood is drawn, creatures can't see within the hood's confines unless you choose to allow it, you are in a source of enhanced light, or the creatures possess {@sense truesight}. Additionally, you have resistance to all damage until the end of your first turn.

When you reach 11th level in operative, when you use your Uncanny {@action Dodge} feature, an illusory duplicate of yourself appears in your space until the start of your next turn. The first attack roll made against you before the start of your next turn has disadvantage.

When you reach 17th level in operative, when you are conscious and fail an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can choose to instead succeed. Once you've done so, you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.
{@i The color of this hood shifts between light gray and black depending on light.}

item.name: Crate
entries: A crate stores 40 gallons of liquid or 4 cubic feet of solid.

item.name: Credit
entries: Credits come in a variety of denominations: from a single chit to cards loaded with incredible value. While the Republic and Empire have their own currencies, in most worlds they can be used interchangeably.

With ten credits, a character can buy a power cell, a stylus, or a glowrod. A skilled (but not exceptional) artisan can earn ten {@item credit|sw5ephb|credits} a day. The credit is the standard unit of measure for wealth, even if the chit itself is not commonly used. When merchants discuss deals that involve goods or services worth hundreds or thousands of credits, the transactions don't usually involve the exchange of individual chits. Rather, the credit is a standard measure of value, and the actual exchange is in credit cards, letters of credit, or valuable goods.
A standard chit weighs about a third of an ounce, so fifty chits weigh a pound.

item.name: Credit Chip (Champion)
entries: The credit chip is a small, flat card that features a security code and algorithm memory stripes. The chip can be preloaded with a specified number of {@item credit|sw5ephb|credits}, or it can draw directly from a specific account held by the user. The credit chip can be accessed with a pin, or by a DC 30 {@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb} check.

item.name: Credit Chip (Exceptional)
entries: The credit chip is a small, flat card that features a security code and algorithm memory stripes. The chip can be preloaded with a specified number of {@item credit|sw5ephb|credits}, or it can draw directly from a specific account held by the user. The credit chip can be accessed with a pin, or by a DC 27 {@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb} check.

item.name: Credit Chip (Fine)
entries: The credit chip is a small, flat card that features a security code and algorithm memory stripes. The chip can be preloaded with a specified number of {@item credit|sw5ephb|credits}, or it can draw directly from a specific account held by the user. The credit chip can be accessed with a pin, or by a DC 18 {@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb} check.

item.name: Credit Chip (Improved)
entries: The credit chip is a small, flat card that features a security code and algorithm memory stripes. The chip can be preloaded with a specified number of {@item credit|sw5ephb|credits}, or it can draw directly from a specific account held by the user. The credit chip can be accessed with a pin, or by a DC 21 {@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb} check.

item.name: Credit Chip (Superior)
entries: The credit chip is a small, flat card that features a security code and algorithm memory stripes. The chip can be preloaded with a specified number of {@item credit|sw5ephb|credits}, or it can draw directly from a specific account held by the user. The credit chip can be accessed with a pin, or by a DC 24 {@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb} check.

item.name: Credit chip
entries: The credit chip is a small, flat card that features a security code and algorithm memory stripes. The chip can be preloaded with a specified number of {@item credit|sw5ephb|credits}, or it can draw directly from a specific account held by the user. The credit chip can be accessed with a pin, or by a DC 15 {@skill slicer's kit|sw5ephb} check.

item.name: Crossguard Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the defensive 1 property. If it already has the defensive property, its defensive number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Crossguard Hilt (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the defensive 3 property. If it already has the defensive property, its defensive number increases to 3.

item.name: Crossguard Hilt (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the defensive 2 property. If it already has the defensive property, its defensive number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Cryo Cell (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

item.name: Cryo Cell (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

item.name: Cryo Cell (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

item.name: Cryo Cell (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

item.name: Cryo Cell (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item cryo cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

item.name: Cryo cell
entries: A cryo cell is a specialized {@item power cell|sw5ephb} for use with blaster weapons that deal acid, energy, fire, ion, or sonic damage. The loaded weapon deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

item.name: Crystalizing Amplifier (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Crystalizing Amplifier (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Crystalizing Amplifier (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Crystalizing Amplifier (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Crystalizing Rangefinder (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Crystalizing Rangefinder (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Crystalizing Rangefinder (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Crystalizing Rangefinder (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks and a -1 penalty to melee force attacks.

item.name: Czerka Attenuating Pulsator
entries: When you score a critical hit or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a ranged attack using this weapon, you can regain a number of tech points equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of one, no action required).  Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Czerka Elite Pro Mk V
entries: When you cast a tech power with this {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} and at least one creature fails its saving throw to resist its effects, you gain a {@dice d12} that you can roll and add to the damage or healing of a tech power you cast. This die lasts for 1 minute, and you can only have one at a time.

item.name: Czerka Variable Claw-Hand Multitool
entries: This augmentation replaces a hand.

As a bonus action, you can transform this claw-hand into one of the following items of your choice, or back its default claw-hand state. While your claw-hand is transformed, you are considered to be proficient in the item it is replicating, if you are not already:

items: {@item Security kit|sw5ephb}
Artisan tools (one set, chosen at the time this augmentation is installed)
{@item Commlink|sw5ephb}
{@item Fusion cutter|sw5ephb}
{@item Grappling hook|sw5ephb} (with 50 feet of fibercord cable)
{@item Hydrospanner|sw5ephb}
{@item Traumakit|sw5ephb}
{@item Repair kit|sw5ephb}
{@item Hidden blade|sw5ephb} {@i (martial vibroweapon)}
{@item Hold out|sw5ephb} {@i (simple blaster)}
{@item Medium shield generator|sw5ephb} {@i (medium armor)}

entries: For items that have charges such as the {@item repair kit|sw5ephb}, you regain all expended charges at the end of a long rest. For items that use {@item power cell|sw5ephb}, you can reload those with {@item power cell|sw5ephb} normally.
{@b Side Effect:} Once this hand replacement has been installed, you can no longer wield weapons in this hand other than those this augmentation can transform into.
{@i The CVCM hand replacement appears to be a simple claw, but it contains a startling variety of tools, transforming to become whatever gadget is needed at the moment.}

item.name: Damind Crystal (Flawed)
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Damind Crystal (Flawless)
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Damind Crystal (Perfect)
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d10} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Damind Crystal (Regular)
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d6} and add the result to the total.

item.name: Daring Acrobat Package
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Dexterity (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.
{@i This implant drastically increases your fine motor skills and reaction times.}

item.name: Darksaber
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item lightsaber|sw5ephb}. Additionally, the weapon ignores resistance to energy damage.

When you attack a creature that has at least one head with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to energy damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the GM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra {@damage 6d6} energy damage from the hit.

{@i The Darksaber was an ancient and unique black-bladed lightsaber created by Tarre Vizsla, the first Mandalorian ever inducted into the Jedi Order. It features a distinctly Mandalorian hilt and an ominous black blade.}

item.name: Darkvision Goggles
entries: While wearing these goggles, you have {@sense darkvision} to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, these goggles increase its range by 30 feet.

item.name: Darkvision Visor
entries: While wearing this armor, you have {@sense darkvision} to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, this modification increases its range by 30 feet.

item.name: Dart
entries: This {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} ammunition deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit.

item.name: Dart (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} {@item dart|sw5ephb}, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the dart has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Dart (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} {@item dart|sw5ephb}, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the dart has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Dart (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage with this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} {@item dart|sw5ephb}, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the dart has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Dart (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} {@item dart|sw5ephb}, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the dart has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Dart (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} {@item dart|sw5ephb}, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the dart has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Datacard
entries: A datacard or data disk is a flat, hand-held device used in conjunction with a {@item datapad|sw5ephb} to store information.

item.name: Datacron
entries: A datacron is a type of {@item holocron|sw5ephb} that can be accessed by non-Force-sensitives and are mainly used to store encrypted data. They are complete with an interactive projection to access the information.

item.name: Datacron Mk I
entries: This {@item datacron|sw5ephb} contains a single at-will tech power. After tinkering with the {@item datacron|sw5ephb} for at least 2 hours, a techcaster with a Max Power Level of 1st or higher can make a DC 10 techcasting ability check with proficiency. On a success, they learn the contained tech power, which does not count against their tech powers known. On a failure, the power is not learned and the techcaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Datacrons are encrypted storage devices that contain an interactive projection, and are used to store high-value, sensitive information.}

item.name: Datacron Mk II
entries: This {@item datacron|sw5ephb} contains a single 1st-level tech power. After tinkering with the {@item datacron|sw5ephb} for at least 4 hours, a techcaster with a Max Power Level of 1st or higher can make a DC 14 techcasting ability check with proficiency. On a success, they learn the contained tech power, which does not count against their tech powers known. On a failure, the power is not learned and the techcaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Datacrons are encrypted storage devices that contain an interactive projection, and are used to store high-value, sensitive information.}

item.name: Datacron Mk III
entries: This {@item datacron|sw5ephb} contains a single 3rd-level tech power, or multiple powers of 1st-2nd level with a combined level no greater than 3. After tinkering with the {@item datacron|sw5ephb} for at least 8 hours, a techcaster with a Max Power Level of 3rd or higher can make a DC 18 techcasting ability check with proficiency. On a success, they learn the contained tech power(s), which does not count against their tech powers known. On a failure, the power is not learned and the techcaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Datacrons are encrypted storage devices that contain an interactive projection, and are used to store high-value, sensitive information.}

item.name: Datacron Mk IV
entries: This {@item datacron|sw5ephb} contains a single 5th-level tech power, or multiple powers of 1st-4th level with a combined level no greater than 5. After tinkering with the {@item datacron|sw5ephb} for at least 16 hours, a techcaster with a Max Power Level of 5th or higher can make a DC 22 techcasting ability check with proficiency. On a success, they learn the contained tech power(s), which does not count against their tech powers known. On a failure, the power is not learned and the techcaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Datacrons are encrypted storage devices that contain an interactive projection, and are used to store high-value, sensitive information.}

item.name: Datacron Mk V
entries: This {@item datacron|sw5ephb} contains a single 7th-level tech power, or multiple powers of 1st-6th level with a combined level no greater than 7. After tinkering with the {@item datacron|sw5ephb} for at least 40 hours, a techcaster with a Max Power Level of 7th or higher can make a DC 26 techcasting ability check with proficiency. On a success, they learn the contained tech power(s), which does not count against their tech powers known. On a failure, the power is not learned and the techcaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Datacrons are encrypted storage devices that contain an interactive projection, and are used to store high-value, sensitive information.}

item.name: Datacron Mk VI
entries: This {@item datacron|sw5ephb} contains a single 9th-level tech power, or multiple powers of 1st-8th level with a combined level no greater than 9. After tinkering with the {@item datacron|sw5ephb} for at least 80 hours, a techcaster with a Max Power Level of 9th or higher can make a DC 30 techcasting ability check with proficiency. On a success, they learn the contained tech power(s), which does not count against their tech powers known. On a failure, the power is not learned and the techcaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Datacrons are encrypted storage devices that contain an interactive projection, and are used to store high-value, sensitive information.}

item.name: Datapad
entries: A datapad is a small electronic device used for the input, storage and displaying of information. It features a holoprojective surface for 3D viewing.

item.name: Deafening Calibrator (Average)
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the sonorous 14 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Deafening Calibrator (Deadly)
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the sonorous 16 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Deafening Calibrator (Devastating)
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +3 bonus to attack rolls and dealing an additional {@damage 1d10} damage for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the sonorous 18 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases to 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Deafening Calibrator (Lethal)
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +3 bonus to attack rolls and dealing an additional {@damage 1d8} damage for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the sonorous 17 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Deafening Calibrator (Major)
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the sonorous 15 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Deafening Cell (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item deafening cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item deafening cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals sonic damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} sonic damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} sonic damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} sonic damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} sonic damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the sonorous 14 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} {@item dart|sw5ephb}, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item dart|sw5ephb} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Defel Mimicker
entries: While you wear this belt, it casts a shadow that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition restrained}, or otherwise unable to move.
{@i The only visible trace of this stealth field generator's user is a vague shadow, much like the Defel themselves.}

item.name: Defensive Guard
entries: This weapon gains the defensive 1 property. If it already has the defensive property, its defensive number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Defensive Guard (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the defensive 3 property. If it already has the defensive property, its defensive number increases to 3.

item.name: Defensive Guard (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the defensive 2 property. If it already has the defensive property, its defensive number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Demolitions kit
entries: Demolitions kits are used to create, enhance, and disarm explosives.

item.name: Detachable Eye
entries: This augmentation replaces an eye.

As an action, you can remove or replace this eye. While removed, the eye sprouts eight small legs, has a speed of 15 feet, an AC of 10, and 1 hit point. As an action on each of your turns, you can move the eye up to its speed as long as it is within 30 feet of you. You can see through both the detached eye and your remaining eye at the same time, or you can use your action to see through only one eye or the other.
{@b Side Effect:} While the eye is removed, you have disadvantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight beyond 5 feet.
{@i This eye replacement is a favored tool for the augmented spy.}

item.name: Detachable Hand
entries: This augmentation replaces a hand.

As an action, you can attach or detach this hand. While detached, the hand has a speed of 15 feet, an AC of 10, and 1 hit point. As an action on each of your turns, you can control the hand as long as it is within 30 feet of you. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a container. You can move the hand up to its speed each time you use it.
{@b Side Effect:} This hand can no longer wield items that weigh more than 7 lbs.
{@i This unique hand replacement is a favored option for those looking into places they aren't welcome.}

item.name: Deuterium-pyro
entries: This alcoholic beverage, favored amongst ruffians, features a terrible flavor and strong aftertaste. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Deuterium-pyro (Aged)
entries: This alcoholic beverage, favored amongst ruffians, features a terrible flavor and strong aftertaste. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Strength. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Deuterium-pyro (Special)

item.name: Dexterity Augment  (Champion)
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 2.

item.name: Dexterity Augment (Basic)
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1. One ability score other than Dexterity (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Dexterity Augment (Exceptional)
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Dexterity Augment (Fine)
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

item.name: Dexterity Augment (Improved)

item.name: Dexterity Enhancement (Basic)
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Dexterity (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Dexterity Stim (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Dexterity Stim (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Dexterity score increases by 10, and its maximum for this score increases by 10. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Dexterity Stim (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Dexterity score increases by 8, and its maximum for this score increases by 8. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Dexterity Stim (Fine)

item.name: Dexterity Stim (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Dexterity score increases by 4, and its maximum for this score increases by 4. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Dexterity Stim (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Dexterity score increases by 6, and its maximum for this score increases by 6. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Dexterity Weave (Champion)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Dexterity saving throws increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Dexterity Weave (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Dexterity saving throws increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Dexterity Weave (Superior)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Dexterity saving throws increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Dominator Belt
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score becomes 29. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 29, it has no effect on you.

{@i While only barely adhering to the most technical definition of a belt, this harness-like rig of pneumaticized limb actuators supplies enormous strength to every limb of its wearer's body, monstrously increasing their physical power.}

item.name: Duplexed Extender Channel
entries: When you cast a force power through this {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can increase the range of that force power by 10 feet.

item.name: Electrifying Calibrator (Average)
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the shocking 14 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Electrifying Calibrator (Deadly)
entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the shocking 16 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the shocking 18 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases to 18. Lastly, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Electrifying Cartridge (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item electrifying cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item electrifying cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage and becomes shocked until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't shocked.

item.name: Electrifying Dart (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} {@item dart|sw5ephb}, which deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item dart|sw5ephb} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Also on a hit, the creature must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d4} lightning damage on a failed save.
Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is shocked for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Electrifying Oscillator
entries: When you hit with the weapon, you can create an electronic burst. Each creature in a 15-foot cone centered on the creature you hit must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d8} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
Once you've used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

entries: As an action, you can apply this calibrator to one vibroweapon or pair of handwraps within 5 feet, granting it a +1 bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, for the duration, the weapon gains the shocking 13 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Electrifying cartridge
entries: An electrifying cartridge is a specialized {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb} for use with blaster weapons that deal kinetic damage. When you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage and becomes shocked until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't shocked.

Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is shocked for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.
