item.name: Emergency Landing Braces
entries: You can use your reaction to reduce any falling damage you would take by half.

item.name: Emergency battery
entries: All non-expendable droids need recharging as they are used. The battery has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the battery to stabilize a droid that has 0 hit points, without needing to make an Intelligence ({@skill Technology}) check.

item.name: Emergency raft
entries: This raft comes packed in a 2-foot-long tube. When activated, the raft quickly deploys, expanding to full size in six seconds. The raft is 6 feet long and 3 feet wide, and can hold up to four Medium creatures not exceeding 800 lb. It comes with two collapsible oars with which to row. The raft can be collapsed and restored over the course of 1 minute.

item.name: Emergency shelter
entries: This shelter comes packed in a 2-foot-long tube. When activated, the shelter deploys, expanding to full size in 1 minute. The shelter is 8 feet long, 8 feet wide, and 6 feet tall, and can house up to six Medium creatures. The shelter includes spikes that automatically mount to the ground, provided they can find purchase. The shelter comes with an integrated {@item power generator|sw5ewh}, faint glowing lights in the interior which provide dim light, and creatures in the shelter are protected from the elements, including hot and cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. The shelter's {@item power generator|sw5ewh} lasts for seven days, after which it stops providing light. The shelter can be collapsed and restored over the course of 10 minutes.

item.name: Empathic Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Insight} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Empathic Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Insight} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Empathic Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Insight} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Empathic Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Insight}.

item.name: Empathic Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Insight} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Empathic Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Insight} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Engineer Defensive Augment
entries: This item becomes a valid target of the Infuse Item feature if it wasn't already, granting a bonus appropriate to the item's type. Additionally, you gain an additional use of your Potent Aptitude.

item.name: Engineer Offensive Augment
entries: When you use your Potent Aptitude feature, you can target an additional creature within 60 feet of you who can hear you and grant them a Potent Aptitude die as well without expending an additional use.

item.name: Enhanced Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points while wearing this armor but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Enhanced Reconstructor
entries: Whenever you roll a Hit Die to recover hit points, you add your Intelligence modifier to the roll (minimum of +1).

item.name: Enviro-suit
entries: Environment suits, atmospheric suits, or EVA suits, are pressure suits that enabled wearers to survive and operate in zero gravity space and other dangerous conditions.

item.name: Environmental Barrier Mk I
entries: As an action, you can administer this barrier to a creature within 5 feet. The barrier has 15 hit points, and lasts 8 hours. Whenever the creature takes damage (one of acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, or sonic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, the creature takes any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Environmental Barrier Mk II
entries: As an action, you can administer this barrier to a creature within 5 feet. The barrier has 30 hit points, and lasts 8 hours. Whenever the creature takes damage (one of acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, or sonic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, the creature takes any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Environmental Barrier Mk III

If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Environmental Barrier Mk IV

Whenever the creature takes damage (one of acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, or sonic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Environmental Barrier Mk V

Whenever the creature takes damage (one of acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, or sonic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Environmental Barrier Mk VI
entries: As an action, you can administer this barrier to a creature within 5 feet. The barrier has 90 hit points, and lasts 8 hours. Whenever the creature takes damage (one of acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, or sonic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Expanded Magazine
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can reload this weapon once without using an action. You can't use this feature again until you reload the weapon with an action.

item.name: Expanded Magazine (Champion)

item.name: Expanded Magazine (Superior)

item.name: Fiber armor
entries: Fiber armor is a type of armor that offers more protection than the lighter {@item combat suit|sw5ephb}. Fiber armor is heavier overall than {@item combat suit|sw5ephb|combat suits}, and not quite as flexible, but many consider the trade-offs worthwhile. It is a good source of defense from physical attacks and light blaster fire.

item.name: Fiber-Alloy Guard
entries: This weapon loses the two-handed property.

item.name: Fighter Defensive Augment
entries: When you use your Second Wind feature, you also gain temporary hit points equal to the amount of hit points you regain.

item.name: Fighter Offensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional maneuver, and you gain one additional superiority die.

item.name: Finesse Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the finesse property.

item.name: Fire extinguisher
entries: As an action, you can expend a use of the extinguisher to create a 15 foot cone of misty air which lasts for 6 seconds, snuffing out any unenhanced fires within range. Additionally, each creature within range must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature becomes immune to this effect. An extinguisher can be used 5 times before it must be replenished at its original cost.

item.name: Flashlight Attachment
entries: You affix a targeted light to this weapon. As a bonus action, you can toggle the light on or off. While on, this weapon sheds bright light in a 60-foot cone.

item.name: Flashlight Guard
entries: You affix a targeted light to this weapon. As a bonus action, you can toggle the light on or off. While on, this weapon sheds bright light in a 60-foot cone.

item.name: Flashy
entries: The first time you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack from this weapon each round, the creature takes an additional {@damage 1d4} damage from the attack.
{@i Flashy is an SSK heavy pistol owned by the mercenary Corso Riggs during the Galactic Cold War.}

item.name: Flask
entries: A flask stores 1 pint of liquid.

item.name: Flechette Clip, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} ammunition fires a volley of kinetic flechette rounds in a short line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a long line 45 feet long and 5 feet wide. A single flechette clip holds enough ammunition for three attacks in a short line or one attack in a long line. Each creature must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d10} kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If you lack proficiency in the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb}, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Flechette Clip, Fragmentation (Deadly)

A single flechette clip holds enough ammunition for three attacks in a short line or one attack in a long line. Each creature must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d10} kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If you lack proficiency in the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb}, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Flechette Clip, Ion (Average)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} ammunition fires a volley of ion flechette rounds in a short line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a long line 45 feet long and 5 feet wide. A single flechette clip holds enough ammunition for three attacks in a short line or one attack in a long line. Each creature must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} ion damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Any electronics within the blast radius that aren't being worn or carried are disabled until rebooted. If you lack proficiency in the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb}, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

entries: When triggered, this enhanced {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} ammunition fires a volley of ion flechette rounds in a short line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a long line 45 feet long and 5 feet wide. A single flechette clip holds enough ammunition for three attacks in a short line or one attack in a long line. Each creature must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} ion damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Any electronics within the blast radius that aren't being worn or carried are disabled until rebooted. If you lack proficiency in the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb}, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Flechette cannon
entries: The flechette cannon does not make attack rolls. Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the flechette cannon uses specialized projector tanks, which, when fired, spray an area with the contents of the tank. Projector tanks require your target to make a saving throw to resist the tank's effects. It can have different ammunition types loaded simultaneously, and you can choose which ammunition you're using as you fire it (no action required). If you don't meet the flechette cannon's strength requirement, creatures have advantage on their saving throws. If you lack proficiency in the flechette cannon, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Flechette clip, fragmentation
entries: When triggered, this {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} ammunition fires a volley of kinetic flechette rounds in a short line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a long line 45 feet long and 5 feet wide. A single flechette clip holds enough ammunition for three attacks in a short line or one attack in a long line. Each creature must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d10} kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If you lack proficiency in the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb}, you have disadvantage on damage rolls with it

item.name: Flechette clip, ion
entries: When triggered, this {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} ammunition fires a volley of ion flechette rounds in a short line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a long line 45 feet long and 5 feet wide. item.name: Flexible Armoring
entries: This armor loses the rigid property.

item.name: Flight suit
entries: Flight suits, or jumpsuits, are a type of outfit worn by pilots. They are worn in conjunction with flight helmets. They come in a variety of different colors and provide life support, and protect from hostile environments.

item.name: Flightsuit
entries: While you are wearing no armor, this clothing has the impermeable 2 ({@item space suit|sw5eec}, {@item diving suit|sw5eec}) property.

item.name: Flux Collimator (Average)
entries: As an action, you can apply this collimator to one lightweapon within 5 feet, granting it a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Flux Collimator (Deadly)
entries: As an action, you can apply this collimator to one lightweapon within 5 feet, granting it a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Flux Collimator (Devastating)
entries: As an action, you can apply this collimator to one lightweapon within 5 feet, granting it a +3 bonus to attack rolls and dealing an additional {@damage 1d10} damage for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Flux Collimator (Lethal)
entries: As an action, you can apply this collimator to one lightweapon within 5 feet, granting it a +3 bonus to attack rolls and dealing an additional {@damage 1d8} damage for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Flux Collimator (Major)
entries: As an action, you can apply this collimator to one lightweapon within 5 feet, granting it a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, if the weapon is not enhanced, it becomes enhanced for the duration.

item.name: Flux collimator
entries: As an action, you can apply this collimator to one lightweapon within 5 feet, granting it a +1 bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon.

item.name: Focus Generator (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to the force attack rolls for force powers you cast through this {@item focus generator|sw5ewh}.

item.name: Focus Generator (Improved)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to the force attack rolls for force powers you cast through this {@item focus generator|sw5ewh}.

item.name: Focus Generator (Superior)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the force attack rolls for force powers you cast through this {@item focus generator|sw5ewh}.

item.name: Focus Generator Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Focus Generator Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Focus Generator Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Focus Generator Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Focus Generator Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Focus Generator Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item focus generator|sw5ewh} modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Focus generator
entries: A focus generator is a handheld object used to help forcecasters learn to focus on their powers.

item.name: Focused Amplifier
entries: This item gains the focused property.

item.name: Focused Conductor
entries: This item gains the focused property.

item.name: Focusing Scope
entries: The simple scope allows you to use a bonus action to take aim at a target you can see. The next attack you make before the end of your next turn does not suffer disadvantage due to being made at long range.

item.name: Forged Ferricite Ascendancy Channel
entries: When you cast a force power of 1st-level or higher that deals damage, you can increase the damage by two and a half times (rounded down) the number of force points spent.

item.name: Forged Ferricite Dueling Channel
entries: When you cast a force power of 1st-level or higher that deals damage, you can increase the damage by the number of force points spent.

item.name: Forged Ferricite Fighting Channel
entries: When you cast a force power of 1st-level or higher that deals damage, you can increase the damage by half (rounded down) the number of force points spent.

item.name: Forged Ferricite Mastery Channel
entries: When you cast a force power of 1st-level or higher that deals damage, you can increase the damage by one and a half times (rounded down) the number of force points spent.

item.name: Forged Ferricite Supremacy Channel
entries: When you cast a force power of 1st-level or higher that deals damage, you can increase the damage by twice the number of force points spent.

item.name: Fortitude Enhancer Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Strength saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Strength saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Fortitude Enhancer Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Constitution saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Fortitude Enhancer Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Strength or Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Strength or Constitution saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Fortitude Protocol Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Strength saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Fortitude Protocol Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Fortitude Protocol Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Strength or Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Four-Armed Combatant
entries: You install two additional arms which you can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms your are benefiting from (no action required).
While you have at least 3 arms free, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

item.name: Friction-grip gear
entries: A special set of gloves and boots that allow the wearer to stick to and climb surfaces. While wearing these items, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and ceilings while leaving your hands free. You also gain a climbing speed equal your walking speed.

item.name: Fusion cutter
entries: A fusion cutter is a handheld cutting tool popular among technicians. It can cut through almost any reinforced material, given enough time. The internal {@item power cell|sw5ephb} supplies an hour's worth of continuous operation.

item.name: GNS Strength Enhancer
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score becomes 25. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 25, it has no effect on you.

{@i This large belt greatly increases a users physical power with an array of repulsorfield microgenerators and a pair of reactive-lift actuators that increase raw force and lift-capacity without any loss of speed or fine motor skills.}

item.name: Gas Cartridge (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

item.name: Gas Cartridge (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

item.name: Gas Cartridge (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

item.name: Gas Cartridge (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

item.name: Gas Cartridge (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item gas cartridge|sw5ewh} has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, when you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

item.name: Gas cartridge
entries: A gas cartridge is a specialized {@item slug cartridge|sw5ephb} for use with blaster weapons that deal kinetic damage. When you hit with a shot with the loaded weapon, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

item.name: Gauntlet Armoring
entries: This armor gains the gauntleted ({@dice 1d4}) property. If it already has the gauntleted property, the gauntleted damage increases by one step (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d6}, or from {@dice d6} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Gauntlet Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the gauntleted ({@dice 1d6}) property. If it already has the gauntleted property, the gauntleted damage increases by two steps (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d8}).

item.name: Gauntlet Armoring Mk III
entries: This armor gains the gauntleted ({@dice 1d8}) property. If it already has the gauntleted property, the gauntleted damage increases to {@dice d8}.

item.name: Gauntlets of the Warrior
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your guardian level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you would use your Force-Empowered Strikes feature, you can expend charges instead of force points.

When you reach 5th level in guardian, when you roll a damage die for your Force-Empowered Strikes or Improved Force-Empowered Strikes feature, if you roll less than your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice), you can use the chosen modifier instead of the result on the die.

When you reach 11th level in guardian, the radius of your Guardian Auras increases by 10 feet. Additionally, when you use your Cause Harm or Lend Aid feature, you can add both your Wisdom and Charisma modifier, instead of just one.

When you reach 17th level in guardian, once per turn, when you roll the maximum on a damage die for your Force-Empowered Strikes or Improved Force-Empowered Strikes feature, you regain a use of your Channel the Force, to a maximum of your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice, minimum of one).
{@i These metallic gauntlets are decorated with ornate, sweeping symbols, and are each inlaid with six precious stones of varying colors.}

item.name: Ghostfire Crystal
entries: This weapon loses the luminous property, if it has it. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon, when you attack a creature with it, the creature can't take reactions until the end of the current turn.
{@i These crystals are so transparent that they are nigh invisible. The blade formed by this form of kyber makes no noise, is dim and may form illusory images as it is used.}

item.name: Giggledust
entries: This sandy-brown powder makes everything humorous while enhancing a creature's nimbleness. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Gloom Cell
entries: This weapon loses the luminous property.

item.name: Glowrod
entries: Glowrods create a beam of light illuminating the area around you in bright light for a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The glowrod lasts for 10 hours and can be recharged by connecting to a power source or by replacing the {@item power cell|sw5ephb}.

item.name: Goggles of the Tinkerer
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your engineer level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. Once per turn, when you use a Potent Aptitude feature, you can spend 1 charge to roll the Potent Aptitude dice twice and add them together.
When you reach 5th level in engineer, you become a valid target of your Potent Aptitude feature. Additionally, you gain 1 additional modification slot.

When you reach 11th level in engineer, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check with tools you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus. Additionally, you gain 1 additional modification slot (2).

When you reach 17th level in engineer, when use your bonus action to grant a Potent Aptitude die, you can grant a {@dice d4} instead of expending a use of your Potent Aptitude. Additionally, you gain 1 additional modification slot (3).
{@i These goggles feature one-way glass lenses. When worn over the eyes, the lenses take whatever appearance the bearer decides.}

item.name: Grappling Harpoon
entries: This armor gains an integrated {@item grappling harpoon|sw5ewh} set into your gauntlet. With this harpoon, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the harpoon. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the harpoon. Removing the harpoon requires a DC 15 Strength check. While the harpoon is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While the harpoon is deployed, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is larger than you. A creature or object your size or smaller is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you've used this feature, you can't use it again until you recover and reinsert the harpoon as an action.

item.name: Grappling hook
entries: A grappling hook allows a user to climb or ascend large objects. It can be mounted to a blaster, belt, or elsewhere. It has a 50-foot length.

item.name: Gravity generator
entries: Gravity generators are special devices typically worn on belts that function as a portable, personal artificial gravity source. Activating or deactivating the belt requires a bonus action and, while active, you are able to move as if in a standard gravitational pull. The generator lasts for 10 minutes and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the {@item power cell|sw5ephb}.

item.name: Grenade Launcher (Champion)
entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the {@item grenade launcher|sw5ewh} fires grenades. When firing a grenade at long range, or if you don't meet the {@item grenade launcher|sw5ewh}'s strength requirement, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. If you lack proficiency in the {@item grenade launcher|sw5ewh}, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total. You have a +3 bonus to the save DC and deal two additional damage dice with grenades fired by this enhanced {@item grenade launcher|sw5ewh}.

entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the grenade launcher fires grenades. item.name: Grenade, Corrosive (Average)
entries: Grenades can be set to detonate on impact or with a timer that causes them to explode on initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties). As an action, you can prime and throw a grenade at a point you can see within 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

As an action, you can prime and throw a grenade at a point you can see within 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. The grenade explodes, filling the air in a 10-foot-radius sphere with yellow-green fog for 1 minute. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of at least 10 miles per hour disperses it.

When a creature enters the fog or starts its turn there, it creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} while it is in the cloud. Droids, constructs and humanoids wearing appropriate protective equipment are unaffected.

entries: The damage die for your Focused Strike die and Improved Force-Empowered Strikes features increases by one step (from {@dice d8} to {@dice d10}, or {@dice d10} to {@dice d12}).

item.name: Handwraps (Basic)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Champion)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Exceptional)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Fine)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Improved)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps (Superior)
entries: While wearing these handwraps, you have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Advanced)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. They can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Artifact)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. They can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Legendary)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. They can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Premium)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications. They can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Prototype)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. They can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Handwraps Chassis (Standard)
entries: These modifiable handwraps chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications. They can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Hardy Torso Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces your torso.

Your Constitution score becomes 13. If your Constitution score is already equal to or greater than 13, it has no effect on you. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against {@item poison|sw5ephb}.
{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 a Constitution saving throw to avoid {@condition exhaustion}, you suffer 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion}, instead of just 1.
{@i For the wary traveler who is desperately afraid of poison.}

item.name: Harpoon Reel Attachment
entries: You install a secondary firemode that launches a harpoon attached to a tightly coiled cord. With this harpoon, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the harpoon. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the harpoon. Removing the harpoon requires a DC 15 Strength check. While the harpoon is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While connected in this manner, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is your size or larger. A creature or object smaller than you is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you've used this feature, you can't use it again until you recover and reinsert the harpoon as an action.

item.name: Harpoon Reel Guard
entries: You install a secondary firemode that launches a harpoon attached to a tightly coiled cord. With this harpoon, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the harpoon. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the harpoon. Removing the harpoon requires a DC 15 Strength check. While the harpoon is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While connected in this manner, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is your size or larger. A creature or object smaller than you is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you've used this feature, you can't use it again until you recover and reinsert the harpoon as an action.

item.name: Hawkeye Ocular Package
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes.

You can activate or deactivate this augmentation as a bonus action. While this augmentation is active, you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight beyond 30 feet. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.
{@b Side Effect:} While this augmentation is active, you have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks within 30 feet that rely on sight.
{@i This eye replacement features integrated macrobinoculars, granting improved ability to see further away.}

item.name: Headcomm
entries: A headcomm can be installed in a helmet or worn independently. It functions as a hands-free {@item commlink|sw5ephb}.

item.name: Heat generator
entries: Heat generators are special devices typically worn on belts that function as a portable, personal heat supply. Activating or deactivating the generator requires a bonus action and, while active, you are adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. The generator lasts for 10 minutes and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the {@item power cell|sw5ephb}.

item.name: Heavy Cell
entries: This weapon gains the heavy property.

item.name: Heavy Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the heavy property.

item.name: Heavy Suit
entries: You enhance this armor, making it difficult to move. As a bonus action, you can anchor or deanchor your feet to the ground. While anchored, your speed is 0, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

item.name: Heavy exoskeleton
entries: Heavy exoskeletons are virtually the heaviest armor acquirable during the Galactic War. It is ideal for extreme combat situations that involved direct damage and also offers a very good level of protection in sacrifice of dexterity. Some consider it claustrophobic but that was the trade-off for safety.

item.name: Helisaber Attachment
entries: As a bonus action, you can activate the attachment. While active, you have a 30-foot flying speed, and whenever you take damage you must make a concentration check as if concentrating on a power. On a failure, you immediately fall to the ground.

item.name: Hewey
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this enhanced weapon.

This weapon has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d6} charges when you complete a long rest. Once per turn when you hit with a melee weapon attack with this weapon, you can expend a charge to have the weapon deal an additional {@damage 1d8} kinetic damage.
{@i Hewey is an N-30 battle blade owned by the mercenary Corso Riggs during the Galactic Cold War.}

item.name: Hidden Compartment Blaster
entries: This implant includes a small hidden blaster that is completely shielded and hidden from unenhanced investigation. You cannot use this hidden blaster until it is revealed. As a bonus action, you can reveal this weapon and make a single ranged weapon attack with it. You have proficiency with this weapon for this attack. It deals {@damage 1d4} energy damage on a hit, has a range of 20/60, and the light and reload 4 properties.

{@b Side Effect:} Reloading this weapon takes longer than usual. You can reload and re-conceal this weapon over one hour, which can be done during a short rest. This hidden compartment can only fit the specific blaster with which it is paired.
{@i This augmentation hides a weapon in its wearer's forearm that is almost completely undetectable by modern sensors.}

item.name: High-Grade Cybernetic Arm
entries: This augmentation replaces an arm.

When you hit with a melee weapon attack using Strength with a weapon wielded by this arm, you gain a +1 bonus to the damage roll. Additionally, when you make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check that involves this arm, you gain a +1 bonus to the check.
{@b Side Effect:} You have disadvantage on melee weapon attacks and ability checks using Dexterity that involve this arm.
{@i This arm replacement features enhanced strength.}

item.name: High-Grade Cybernetic Legs
entries: This augmentation replaces both legs.

You gain advantage on Strength ability checks and Strength saving throws, you can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet, and your speed increases by 10 feet.
{@b Side Effect:} Your powerful legs have difficulty moving quietly. You have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on moving silently.
{@i This mechanical leg replacement increases speed and jumping height.}

item.name: Hilt Blaster
entries: You convert this weapon's hilt into a small blaster. The blaster is a ranged weapon with the range 20/60 and reload 6 properties that you are proficient with, and deals {@damage 1d4} energy damage.

item.name: Holocomm
entries: A holocomm is a communications unit that utilizes the HoloNet. It enables users to send and receive messages through holographic-based transmission networks.

item.name: Holocron
entries: Holocrons are information-storage devices used by force wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form. They appear as palm-sized, glowing polyhedrons of crystalline material and hardware, and can only be activated and used through the power of the Force.

item.name: Holocron (Adept)
entries: This holocron contains a single 5th-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-4th level with a combined level no greater than 5. After meditating with the holocron for at least 16 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 5th or higher can make a DC 22 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the contained force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@spell remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Ancient)
entries: This holocron contains a single 9th-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-8th level with a combined level no greater than 9. After meditating with the holocron for at least 80 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 9th or higher can make a DC 30 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the contained force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@spell remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Apprentice)
entries: This holocron contains a single 1st-level force power. After meditating with the holocron for at least 4 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 1st or higher can make a DC 14 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power stored within. On a success, they learn the contained force power, which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@spell remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Journeyman)
entries: This holocron contains a single 3rd-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-2nd level with a combined level no greater than 3. After meditating with the holocron for at least 8 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 3rd or higher can make a DC 18 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the contained force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@spell remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Master)
entries: This holocron contains a single 7th-level force power, or multiple powers of 1st-6th level with a combined level no greater than 7. After meditating with the holocron for at least 40 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 7th or higher can make a DC 26 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power(s) stored within. On a success, they learn the contained force power(s), which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@spell remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holocron (Novice)
entries: This holocron contains a single at-will force power. After meditating with the holocron for at least 2 hours, a forcecaster with a Max Power Level of 1st or higher can make a DC 10 forcecasting ability check with proficiency based on the alignment of the power stored within. On a success, they learn the contained force power, which does not count against their force powers known and can not be unlearned except through use of a {@spell remove curse} power. On a failure, the power is not learned and the forcecaster can't try again for 24 hours.
{@i Holocrons are information-storage devices used by Force-wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form.}

item.name: Holorecorder
entries: A holorecorder is a device used to record and project holograms. Some droid models are equipped with internal holorecorders.

item.name: Holotrace device
entries: A holotrace device is a wrist-worn gadget that can be used to trace a holographic transmission back to its source.

item.name: Holster
entries: A holster can be worn on the leg, hip, or back, and can be used to store a single weapon. You can draw a weapon stored in a holster without using an action. Once you've done so, you can't do so again until you store a weapon in the holster as an action.

item.name: Homing beacon
entries: A homing beacon is a device used to track starships or any other entity being transported. Homing beacons transmit using non-mass HoloNet transceivers able to be tracked through hyperspace. Homing beacons are small enough that they can easily be hidden inside a ship, or tucked into some crevice on its exterior.

item.name: Horizontal Exojets
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Dodge} or {@action Dash} actions, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your turn.

item.name: Hovercart
entries: This repulsorcraft is designed to efficiently move large amounts of goods. It has a speed of 30 feet and can store 2,000 lb., not exceeding 120 cubic feet.

item.name: Humanoid Replicant
entries: Your droid gains an exterior layer that makes it indistinguishable from a species of your choice of the same size. Additionally, you have advantage on checks made to conceal your nature, and scanners of standard rarity or lower automatically fail to determine that you are a droid.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the strength number is 11, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk II
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the strength number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk III
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the strength number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk IV
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the strength number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk V
entries: This armor or shield's strength number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the strength number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Hydraulic Equalizer Mk VI
entries: This armor or shield loses the strength property.

item.name: IWS
item.modal: {@item blaster rifle|sw5ephb}, {@item grenade launcher|sw5ewh}, and {@item sniper rifle|sw5ephb}

item.name: Impermeable Armoring
entries: This armor gains the impermeable property.

item.name: Impermeable Inlay (Basic)
entries: This clothing gains the impermeable 2 armor property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable armor property, its impermeable number increases by 2, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Inlay (Champion)
entries: This clothing gains the impermeable 9 armor property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable armor property, its impermeable number increases to 9.

item.name: Impermeable Inlay (Exceptional)
entries: This clothing gains the impermeable 8 armor property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable armor property, its impermeable number increases by 8, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Inlay (Fine)
entries: This clothing gains the impermeable 3 armor property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable armor property, its impermeable number increases by 3, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Inlay (Improved)
entries: This clothing gains the impermeable 5 armor property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable armor property, its impermeable number increases by 5, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Inlay (Superior)
entries: This clothing gains the impermeable 6 armor property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable armor property, its impermeable number increases by 6, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Overlay Mk I
entries: This armor gains the impermeable 2 property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable property, its impermeable number increases by 2, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Overlay Mk II
entries: This armor gains the impermeable 3 property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable property, its impermeable number increases by 3, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Overlay Mk III
entries: This armor gains the impermeable 5 property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable property, its impermeable number increases by 5, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Overlay Mk IV
entries: This armor gains the impermeable 6 property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable property, its impermeable number increases by 6, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Overlay Mk V
entries: This armor gains the impermeable 8 property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable property, its impermeable number increases by 8, to a maximum of 9.

item.name: Impermeable Overlay Mk VI
entries: This armor gains the impermeable 9 property (suits chosen by the GM). If it already has the impermeable property, its impermeable number increases to 9.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d12} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary Cell (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh}. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item incendiary cell|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, the loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Incendiary cell
entries: An incendiary cell is a specialized {@item power cell|sw5ephb} for use with blaster weapons that deal acid, energy, fire, ion, or sonic damage. The loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

item.name: Inconspicuous Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield loses the obtrusive property.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Adept)
entries: This item gains the increasing 40 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 40, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Ancient)
entries: This item gains the increasing 60 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases to 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Apprentice)
entries: This item gains the increasing 20 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 20, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Journeyman)
entries: This item gains the increasing 30 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 30, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Master)
entries: This item gains the increasing 50 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 50, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Cycler (Novice)
entries: This item gains the increasing 10 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 10, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk I
entries: This item gains the increasing 10 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 10, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk II
entries: This item gains the increasing 20 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 20, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk III
entries: This item gains the increasing 30 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 30, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk IV
entries: This item gains the increasing 40 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 40, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk V
entries: This item gains the increasing 50 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases by 50, to a maximum of 60.

item.name: Increasing Motherboard Mk VI
entries: This item gains the increasing 60 property. If it already has the increasing property, its increasing number increases to 60.

item.name: Indomitable Fortress Package
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Constitution (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.
{@i This implant drastically increases your endurance.}

item.name: Infiltration Package
entries: This augmentation replaces a hand.

This implant appears to be a standard cybernetic mechanical arm, but conceals a {@item security kit|sw5ephb} and a {@item slicer's kit|sw5ephb}. Additionally, you can also use an action to cast {@spell release|sw5ephb} at 2nd level without expending tech points or use of a tech focus. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for this power. Once you've done so, you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.
{@b Side Effect:} This hand can no longer wield items that weigh more than 7 lbs.
{@i This fully cybernetic hand replacement contains a hidden array of infiltration tools optimized for defeating a wide variety of security barriers.}

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Adequate)
entries: This item gains the inflating 10 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 10, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Excellent)
entries: This item gains the inflating 20 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 20, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Leading)
entries: This item gains the inflating 15 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 15, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Outstanding)
entries: This item gains the inflating 25 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 25, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Prime)
entries: This item gains the inflating 30 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases to 30.

item.name: Inflating Amplifier (Simple)
entries: This item gains the inflating 5 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 5, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Chipped)
entries: This item gains the inflating 10 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 10, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Cracked)
entries: This item gains the inflating 5 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 5, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Flawed)
entries: This item gains the inflating 15 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 15, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Flawless)
entries: This item gains the inflating 25 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 25, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Perfect)
entries: This item gains the inflating 30 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases to 30.

item.name: Inflating Conductor (Regular)
entries: This item gains the inflating 20 property. If it already has the inflating property, its inflating number increases by 20, to a maximum of 30.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Adept)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Apprentice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Journeyman)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Amplifier (Novice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee force attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Adept)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Apprentice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Journeyman)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged force attacks.

item.name: Inlay Rangefinder (Novice)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged force attacks and a -1 penalty to melee force attacks.

item.name: Inquisitor Saber
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced weapon.

As a bonus action, you cause the {@item lightsaber|sw5ephb} to rapidly spin. When you do so, you lose the +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon, but you gain a +1 bonus to AC. Additionally, while spinning, you have a 30-foot flying speed. While flying, if you take damage, you must make a concentration check as if concentrating on a power. On a failure, you immediately fall to the ground.
{@i These lightweapons, favored by the Jedi hunters known as Inquisitors, have the unique ability to rapidly spin, granting its wielder a limited flying ability.}

item.name: Insulated Pattern (Basic)
entries: This clothing gains the insulated 5 armor property. If it already has the insulated armor property, its insulated number increases by 1, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Pattern (Champion)
entries: This clothing gains the insulated 10 armor property. If it already has the insulated armor property, its insulated number increases to 10.

item.name: Insulated Pattern (Exceptional)
entries: This clothing gains the insulated 9 armor property. If it already has the insulated armor property, its insulated number increases by 5, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Pattern (Fine)
entries: This clothing gains the insulated 6 armor property. If it already has the insulated armor property, its insulated number increases by 2, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Pattern (Improved)
entries: This clothing gains the insulated 7 armor property. If it already has the insulated armor property, its insulated number increases by 3, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Pattern (Superior)
entries: This clothing gains the insulated 8 armor property. If it already has the insulated armor property, its insulated number increases by 4, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Basic)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 5 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 1, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Champion)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 10 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases to 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Exceptional)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 9 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 5, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Fine)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 6 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 2, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Improved)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 7 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 3, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Insulated Reinforcement (Superior)
entries: This armor or shield gains the insulated 8 property. If it already has the insulated property, its insulated number increases by 4, to a maximum of 10.

item.name: Integrated Jetboosters Mk I
entries: This armor has a {@item jetpack|sw5ephb} built in. Activating or deactivating the {@item jetpack|sw5ephb} requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The {@item jetpack|sw5ephb} last for 1 minute per {@item power cell|sw5ephb} (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the {@item power cell|sw5ephb}.

item.name: Integrated Subdermal Armor
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
{@b Side Effect:} Each time you take damage while you aren't wearing armor, your speed decreases by 5 feet until the start of your next turn.
{@i This implant reinforces your skin with an ablative woven alloy, making you difficult to damage.}

item.name: Integrated Subdermal Armor Mk II
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier.
{@b Side Effect:} Each time you take damage while you aren't wearing armor, your speed decreases by 5 feet until the start of your next turn.
{@i This implant reinforces your skin with a high-strength cortosis reinforcement, making you very difficult to damage.}

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Basic)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1. One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Champion)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 2.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Exceptional)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Fine)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Improved)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Augment (Superior)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Enhancement (Basic)
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 10, and its maximum for this score increases by 10. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 8, and its maximum for this score increases by 8. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 2, and its maximum for this score increases by 2. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 4, and its maximum for this score increases by 4. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Stim (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Intelligence score increases by 6, and its maximum for this score increases by 6. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Intelligence Weave (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Intelligence saving throws increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Intelligence Weave (Exceptional)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Intelligence saving throws increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Intelligence Weave (Improved)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Intelligence saving throws increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Interface Protocol
entries: You become a valid target for the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5ephb} tech power.

item.name: Interfaced Assistance Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5ephb} tech power, whenever your handler has advantage on an ability check or attack roll granted by you taking the {@action Help} action, they can reroll one of the dice once.

item.name: Interfaced Crafting Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5ephb} tech power, whenever your handler makes an ability check using tools with which the you are also proficient, they have advantage on the check. If they already have advantage, they can instead reroll one of the dice once.

item.name: Interfaced Distraction Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5ephb} tech power, when you are within 5 feet of a target, your handler does not provoke opportunity attacks when moving out of that creature's reach.

item.name: Interfaced Healing Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5ephb} tech power, when your handler restores hit points to a creature that is within 5 feet of you, they can roll the dice twice and take either total.

item.name: Interfaced Tracking Protocol
entries: While you are interfaced via the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5ephb} tech power, when your handler makes a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to track a target, and you are also tracking that target, your handler gains advantage on the check. If they already have advantage, they can instead reroll one of the dice once.

item.name: Interlocking Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the interlocking 1 property. If it already has the interlocking property, its interlocking number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Interlocking Shielding Mk II
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the interlocking 2 property. If it already has the interlocking property, its interlocking number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Interlocking Shielding Mk III
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the interlocking 3 property. If it already has the interlocking property, its interlocking number increases to 3.

item.name: Intuitive Facial Prosthesis
entries: This augmentation replaces your face.

Your Intelligence score becomes 13. If your Intelligence score is already equal to or greater than 13, it has no effect on you. Additionally, you can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to any Intelligence check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

{@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 an Intelligence saving throw, the implant stutters, causing any ability checks in which you are proficient you make before the start of your next turn to not include your proficiency bonus.
{@i This facial prosthetic includes a solid state drive, allowing for quick recall.}

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in {@skill Investigation}.

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Investigator's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in {@skill Investigation} increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Ion Amplifying Core
entries: This weapon ignores resistance to ion damage.

item.name: Iridonian Grav-lev Arm
entries: This augmentation replaces a hand.

Your unarmed strikes with this arm deal {@damage 1d4} ion damage, and your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples. Additionally, you deal double damage to energy-based structures with your unarmed strikes.
