item.name: Tool Integration
entries: One tool of your choice in which you are proficient is integrated into your chassis.

item.name: Torchy
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this enhanced weapon, and when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d4} energy damage for each size category larger than you it is (up to {@damage 3d4} extra damage).
{@i Torchy is a BlasTech ALT-25 blaster pistol owned by the mercenary Corso Riggs during the Galactic Cold War.}

item.name: Torpedo Launcher (Fine)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, the damage of torpedoes fired by this weapon increases by one step (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d6}, {@dice d6} to {@dice d8}, {@dice d8} to {@dice d10}, {@dice d10} to {@dice d12}, or {@dice d12} to {@dice d20}). If this would increase the damage die above a {@dice d20}, instead add an additional five dice to the torpedo's damage for each step above a {@dice d20}.

item.name: Torpedo Launcher (Improved)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, the damage of torpedoes fired by this weapon increases by two steps (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d8}, {@dice d6} to {@dice d10}, {@dice d8} to {@dice d12}, or {@dice d10} to {@dice d20}). If this would increase the damage die above a {@dice d20}, instead add an additional five dice to the torpedo's damage for each step above a {@dice d20}.

item.name: Torpedo Launcher (Superior)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, the damage of torpedoes fired by this weapon increases by three steps (from {@dice d4} to {@dice d10}, {@dice d6} to {@dice d12}, or {@dice d8} to {@dice d20}). If this would increase the damage die above a {@dice d20}, instead add an additional five dice to the torpedo's damage for each step above a {@dice d20}.

item.name: Torpedo launcher
entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the torpedo launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of torpedoes. Torpedo launchers have advantage on attack rolls against Gargantuan creatures and disadvantage on attack rolls against Large and smaller creatures. Unlike other weapons, the torpedo launcher can only be loaded using an action, and you don't add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls you make with it.

The torpedo launcher requires the use of a {@item tripod|sw5ephb}, which is included in the price. Over the course of 1 minute, you can deploy or collapse the torpedo launcher on the {@item tripod|sw5ephb}. While deployed, your speed is reduced to 0.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d6} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d10} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d20} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d12} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d8} kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d6} energy damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d10} energy damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d20} energy damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the {@item power generator|sw5ewh} is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d12} energy damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced {@item torpedo launcher|sw5eec} ammunition, which deals {@damage 20d8} energy damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Tracker utility vest
entries: A utility vest is a sleeveless item of clothing that includes several evenly-distributed pockets, popular among hunters, smugglers, and adventurers. The vest is made of leathery, hide material to resist rips, corrosion and water. The wearer can carry up to 10 light items (up to 1.00 lb each) without increasing their total encumbrance.

item.name: Tranquilizer rifle
entries: The tranquilizer rifle includes a specialized compartment for {@item poison|sw5ephb}. One dose of {@item poison|sw5ephb}, when installed in this compartment, retains its potency for 1 hour before drying. One dose of {@item poison|sw5ephb} is effective for the next 4 shots fired by the weapon. Additionally, creatures reduced to 0 hit points by this weapon are immediately stabilized, unless that damage would instantly kill them.

item.name: Trapper's kit
entries: Trapper's kits can create, disarm, and disassemble traps.

item.name: Traumakit
entries: A common traumakit is stocked with essentials for the treatment of wounds. A traumakit has five uses. As an action, you can expend a use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.

item.name: Tripod
entries: A tripod is a device mounted to a two-handed blaster that lacks the fixed property to offer increased stability. Over the course of 1 minute, you can deploy or collapse the tripod. While deployed, you ignore the Strength requirement on the attached blaster with the strength property, and your speed is reduced to 0. Additionally, while deployed, you have a +10 bonus to ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of the weapon.

item.name: Tsiraki
entries: Tsiraki is a blue-colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Tsiraki (Aged)
entries: Tsiraki is a blue-colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Tsiraki (Fine)
entries: Tsiraki is a blue-colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d4} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Tsiraki (Matured)
entries: Tsiraki is a blue-colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d6} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Tsiraki (Reserve)
entries: Tsiraki is a blue-colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d10} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Tsiraki (Special)
entries: Tsiraki is a blue-colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d12} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d12} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Uncanniness Motivator
entries: When you or a creature you can see that can see and understand you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add it to their roll (no action required). You can use this before or after the roll, but before the GM determines the roll's outcome. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Underlay Amplifier Mk I
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee tech attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Underlay Amplifier Mk II
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Underlay Amplifier Mk III
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Underlay Amplifier Mk IV
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Underlay Rangefinder Mk I
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged tech attacks and a -1 penalty to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Underlay Rangefinder Mk II
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Underlay Rangefinder Mk III
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Underlay Rangefinder Mk IV
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Underwater respirator
entries: Underwater respirators are worn over the mouth and lower face. While worn, you can breath underwater, as the respirator filters the water to create breathable oxygen. The respirator functions for 1 hour per {@item power cell|sw5ephb} (to a maximum of 2 hours) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}.

item.name: Vambraces of the Outrider
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your scout level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you cast a tech power of 1st level or higher, you can expend one or more charges to reduce the tech power's cost by 1 per charge spent, to a minimum of 1.

When you reach 5th level in scout, you can maintain two targets of your Ranger's Quarry feature, instead of one. Additionally, the reload value of the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} increases by 1, to 2.

When you reach 11th level in scout, when you are forced to make a concentration check by the target of your Ranger's Quarry, you have advantage on the check and add your Intelligence modifier to the roll. Additionally, the reload value of the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} increases by 1, to 3.

When you reach 17th level in scout, when you miss with a tech or weapon attack, the target takes damage equal to the attack's governing ability modifier. If the target of the attack is the target of your Ranger's Quarry feature, you can choose to deal your Ranger's Quarry damage as well. Additionally, the reload value of the {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb} increases by 1, to 4.

{@i This pair of matching vambraces are inlaid with the etched visage of an eagle. One contains an integrated {@item wristpad|sw5ephb}, while the other contains an integrated {@item wrist launcher|sw5ephb}.}

item.name: Vapor projector
entries: The vapor projector does not make attack rolls. Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the vapor projector uses specialized projector tanks, which, when fired, spray an area with the contents of the tank.

Projector tanks require your target to make a saving throw to resist the tank's effects. It can have different ammunition types loaded simultaneously, and you can choose which ammunition you're using as you fire it (no action required). If you don't meet the vapor projector's strength requirement, creatures have advantage on their saving throws. If you lack proficiency in the vapor projector, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Vayerbok
entries: Vayerbok is a thick, green, vegetable-based alcoholic beverage typically served hot. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Vayerbok (Aged)
entries: Vayerbok is a thick, green, vegetable-based alcoholic beverage typically served hot. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d8} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Vayerbok (Fine)
entries: Vayerbok is a thick, green, vegetable-based alcoholic beverage typically served hot. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d4} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Vayerbok (Matured)
entries: Vayerbok is a thick, green, vegetable-based alcoholic beverage typically served hot. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d6} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Vayerbok (Reserve)
entries: Vayerbok is a thick, green, vegetable-based alcoholic beverage typically served hot. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d10} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Vayerbok (Special)
entries: Vayerbok is a thick, green, vegetable-based alcoholic beverage typically served hot. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d12} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a {@dice d12} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Wisdom. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Venomous Oscillator
entries: As a bonus action, you can coat this weapon in a thin layer of {@item poison|sw5ephb} for 1 minute. The next time you hit with the weapon, the creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d10} poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.
Once you've used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Ventilation Stabilizer
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action and hit a creature with this weapon, you can repeat the attack against another creature within 5 feet, no action required. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Verpine Auto-Shielding Unit
entries: While wearing this shield generator, you can speak its command word as a bonus action to cause it to animate. The shield projects into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, until you use a bonus action to end this effect, or until you are {@condition incapacitated} or die, at which point the shield deactivates.
{@i The pinnacle of Verpine scientists' shameless theft of ancient Arkanian energy shield designs.}

item.name: Versatile Frame
entries: This weapon gains the versatile ({@dice 1d10}) property. If it already has the versatile property, the versatile damage increases by one step (from {@dice 2d4} to {@dice d10}, {@dice d10} to {@dice d12}, from {@dice d12} to {@dice 2d6}, or from {@dice 2d6} to {@dice 3d4}).

item.name: Versatile Frame (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the versatile ({@dice 2d6}) property. If it already has the versatile property, the versatile damage increases by three steps (from {@dice 2d4} to {@dice 2d6}, {@dice d10} to {@dice 3d4}, from {@dice d12} to {@dice 3d4}, or from {@dice 2d6} to {@dice 3d4}).

item.name: Versatile Frame (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the versatile ({@dice 1d12}) property. If it already has the versatile property, the versatile damage increases by two steps (from {@dice 2d4} to {@dice d12}, {@dice d10} to {@dice 2d6}, from {@dice d12} to {@dice 3d4}, or from {@dice 2d6} to {@dice 3d4}).

item.name: Versatile Handle
entries: This weapon gains the versatile ({@dice 1d10}) property. If it already has the versatile property, the versatile damage increases by one step (from {@dice 2d4} to {@dice d10}, {@dice d10} to {@dice d12}, from {@dice d12} to {@dice 2d6}, or from {@dice 2d6} to {@dice 3d4}).

item.name: Versatile Handle (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the versatile ({@dice 2d6}) property. If it already has the versatile property, the versatile damage increases by three steps (from {@dice 2d4} to {@dice 2d6}, {@dice d10} to {@dice 3d4}, from {@dice d12} to {@dice 3d4}, or from {@dice 2d6} to {@dice 3d4}).

item.name: Versatile Handle (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the versatile ({@dice 1d12}) property. If it already has the versatile property, the versatile damage increases by two steps (from {@dice 2d4} to {@dice d12}, {@dice d10} to {@dice 2d6}, from {@dice d12} to {@dice 3d4}, or from {@dice 2d6} to {@dice 3d4}).

item.name: Versatile Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the versatile 1 property. If it already has the versatile property, its versatile number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Versatile Shielding Mk II
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the versatile 2 property. If it already has the versatile property, its versatile number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Versatile Shielding Mk III
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield}
This shield gains the versatile 3 property. If it already has the versatile property, its versatile number increases to 3.

item.name: Versatility Motivator
entries: Your speed increases by 5 feet, and you can now speak Binary in addition to understanding it.

item.name: Vial
entries: A vial stores 4 ounces of liquid.

item.name: Vibro-lance
entries: You have disadvantage when you use a vibrolance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: Vibrodart
entries: Due to their diminutive size, vibrodarts make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.

item.name: Vibroweapon Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable vibroweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Vibroweapon Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable vibroweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Vibroweapon Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable vibroweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Vibroweapon Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable vibroweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Vibroweapon Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable vibroweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Vibroweapon Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable vibroweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for vibroweapon modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Vicious Ascendancy Core
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 3 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases to 3.

item.name: Vicious Ascendancy Guard
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 3 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases to 3.

item.name: Vicious Ascendancy Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 3 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases to 3.

item.name: Vicious Fighting Core
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 1 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Vicious Fighting Guard
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 1 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Vicious Fighting Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 1 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Vicious Mastery Core
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 2 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Vicious Mastery Guard
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 2 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Vicious Mastery Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the vicious 2 property. If it already has the vicious property, its vicious number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Viir Agathys's Armor
entries: This armor has 3 charges. As an action, you can spend 1 or more charges to cast the {@spell voltaic shielding|sw5ephb} tech power, 1 charge per level. All expended charges are regained after you complete a long rest.
{@i This proprietary armor made by the renowned engineer Viir Agathys includes integrated access to his signature tech power.}

item.name: Viir Agathys's Armoring
entries: This armor has 3 charges. As an action, you can spend 1 or more charges to cast the {@spell voltaic shielding|sw5ephb} tech power, 1 charge per level. All expended charges are regained after you complete a long rest.
{@i This armoring grants access to renowned engineer Viir Agathys's signature tech power.}

item.name: Vitapac (Basic)
entries: This fast-acting syringe grants a revitalizing boost. As an action, you can use this vitapac to restore expended Hit Dice to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature immediately regains two Hit Dice. If the creature has spent Hit Dice of different sizes, determine which Hit Dice are restored randomly.

item.name: Vitapac (Champion)
entries: This fast-acting syringe grants a revitalizing boost. As an action, you can use this vitapac to restore expended Hit Dice to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature immediately regains nine Hit Dice. If the creature has spent Hit Dice of different sizes, determine which Hit Dice are restored randomly.

item.name: Vitapac (Exceptional)
entries: This fast-acting syringe grants a revitalizing boost. As an action, you can use this vitapac to restore expended Hit Dice to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature immediately regains eight Hit Dice. If the creature has spent Hit Dice of different sizes, determine which Hit Dice are restored randomly.

item.name: Vitapac (Fine)
entries: This fast-acting syringe grants a revitalizing boost. As an action, you can use this vitapac to restore expended Hit Dice to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature immediately regains three Hit Dice. If the creature has spent Hit Dice of different sizes, determine which Hit Dice are restored randomly.

item.name: Vitapac (Improved)
entries: This fast-acting syringe grants a revitalizing boost. As an action, you can use this vitapac to restore expended Hit Dice to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature immediately regains five Hit Dice. If the creature has spent Hit Dice of different sizes, determine which Hit Dice are restored randomly.

item.name: Vitapac (Superior)
entries: This fast-acting syringe grants a revitalizing boost. As an action, you can use this vitapac to restore expended Hit Dice to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature immediately regains six Hit Dice. If the creature has spent Hit Dice of different sizes, determine which Hit Dice are restored randomly.

item.name: Vocoder (Basic)
entries: A vocoder is an adjustment to a droid's speech center. The vocoder includes five languages, and grants the droid the ability to speak, read, and write each language. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Vocoder (Champion)
entries: A vocoder is an adjustment to a droid's speech center. The vocoder includes all registered languages, and grants the droid the ability to speak, read, and write each language.

item.name: Vocoder (Exceptional)
entries: A vocoder is an adjustment to a droid's speech center. The vocoder includes 80 languages, and grants the droid the ability to speak, read, and write each language. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Vocoder (Fine)
entries: A vocoder is an adjustment to a droid's speech center. The vocoder includes 10 languages, and grants the droid the ability to speak, read, and write each language. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Vocoder (Improved)
entries: A vocoder is an adjustment to a droid's speech center. The vocoder includes 20 languages, and grants the droid the ability to speak, read, and write each language. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Vocoder (Superior)
entries: A vocoder is an adjustment to a droid's speech center. The vocoder includes 40 languages, and grants the droid the ability to speak, read, and write each language. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Vocoder mask
entries: A vocoder mask is worn over the nose and mouth of a creature, and can translate verbal communications between up to 15 languages. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Water suit
entries: Water suits are sealed suits that prevent water from getting in or out. Additionally, while wearing a water suit, you can breath underwater, as the suit filters the water to create breathable oxygen.

item.name: Weapon (Champion)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage with this enhanced weapon.

item.name: Weapon (Exceptional)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with this enhanced weapon.

item.name: Weapon (Fine)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced weapon.

item.name: Weapon (Improved)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced weapon.

item.name: Weapon (Superior)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced weapon.

item.name: Weapon Integration Armoring
entries: You can integrate a single weapon that weighs no more than 8 lb. into this armor. While integrated, that weapon gains the hidden property. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength saving throws to avoid being disarmed.

item.name: Weave armor
entries: Weave armor was constructed from a mesh of metal or composite plates and a padded jumpsuit. Variants of the armor included less plates and more padding for a lighter, though less protect-ive armor, and heavier plating with molded pieces to fit the wearer. Though the armor was available unmodified, most users personalized their armor.

item.name: Will Enhancer Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Charisma saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Charisma saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Will Enhancer Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Wisdom saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Wisdom saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Will Enhancer Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
{@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Will Protocol Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Charisma saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Will Protocol Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Wisdom saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Will Protocol Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Wisdom Augment (Basic)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1. One ability score other than Wisdom (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Wisdom Augment (Champion)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 2.

item.name: Wisdom Augment (Exceptional)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Wisdom Augment (Fine)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

item.name: Wisdom Augment (Improved)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. One ability score other than Wisdom (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Wisdom Augment (Superior)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Wisdom Enhancement (Basic)
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Wisdom (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Wisdom Stim (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Wisdom score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Wisdom Stim (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Wisdom score increases by 10, and its maximum for this score increases by 10. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Wisdom Stim (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Wisdom score increases by 8, and its maximum for this score increases by 8. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Wisdom Stim (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Wisdom score increases by 2, and its maximum for this score increases by 2. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Wisdom Stim (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Wisdom score increases by 4, and its maximum for this score increases by 4. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Wisdom Stim (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Wisdom score increases by 6, and its maximum for this score increases by 6. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Wisdom Weave (Champion)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Wisdom saving throws increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Wisdom Weave (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Wisdom saving throws increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Wisdom Weave (Superior)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Wisdom saving throws increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Wise Sage Package
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws.
{@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Wisdom (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.
{@i This implant drastically increases your aural awareness.}

item.name: Withercasting Channel (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to the force save DC of powers that require a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw.

item.name: Withercasting Channel (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to the force save DC of powers that require a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw.

item.name: Withercasting Channel (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to the force save DC of powers that require a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw.

item.name: Withercasting Channel (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to the force save DC of powers that require a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw and a -1 penalty to the force save DC of powers that require a Strength or Constitution saving throw.

item.name: Withering Channel (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the withering 3 property. If it already has the withering property, its withering number increases to 3.

item.name: Withering Channel (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the withering 1 property. If it already has the withering property, its withering number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Withering Channel (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the withering 2 property. If it already has the withering property, its withering number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Withering Processor (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the withering 3 property. If it already has the withering property, its withering number increases to 3.

item.name: Withering Processor (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the withering 1 property. If it already has the withering property, its withering number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Withering Processor (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the withering 2 property. If it already has the withering property, its withering number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Wrist Mount Attachment
entries: This weapon gains the fixed property.

item.name: Wrist Mount Guard
entries: This weapon gains the fixed property.

item.name: Wrist Mount Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the fixed property.

item.name: Wrist launcher
entries: Rather than traditional {@item power cell|sw5ephb|power cells}, the wrist launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of {@item dart|sw5ephb|darts}, small missiles, or specialized canisters.
item.ammoType: darts, small missiles, or specialized canisters

item.name: Wrist-Mounted Grappling Hook
entries: You craft a wrist-mounted {@item grappling hook|sw5ephb} weapon attached to a tightly coiled cord. With this grappler, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d4} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the hook. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the hook. Removing the hook requires a DC 13 Strength check. While the hook is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While the hook is deployed, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is your size or larger. A creature or object smaller than you is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you've used this feature, you can't use it again until you recover and reinsert the hook as an action.

item.name: Wristpad
entries: A wristpad is a harness with an integrated {@item datapad|sw5ephb} and holoprojector interface that fits on the forearm and includes self-charging battery packs.

item.name: Wristpad (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to the tech attack rolls for tech powers you cast through this wristpad.

item.name: Wristpad (Improved)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to the tech attack rolls for tech powers you cast through this wristpad.

item.name: Wristpad (Superior)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the tech attack rolls for tech powers you cast through this wristpad.

item.name: Wristpad Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable wristpad chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Wristpad Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable wristpad chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Wristpad Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable wristpad chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Wristpad Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable wristpad chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Wristpad Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable wristpad chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Wristpad Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable wristpad chassis comes with vacant modification slots for {@item wristpad|sw5ephb} modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Xerrol Nightstinger Rifle
entries: You have a +1 bonus to damage rolls with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, when you make the Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check to remain hidden as a part of the weapon's silent property, you have advantage on the check.
{@i This nightstinger rifle has the unique property of shooting invisible rounds.}

item.name: Yaladai
entries: Yaladai is a powerful stimulant that grants extreme clarity, improving relaxation and focus. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d3}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d3}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Yaladai (Fine)
entries: Yaladai is a powerful stimulant that grants extreme clarity, improving relaxation and focus. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d4}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d4}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Yaladai (High Quality)
entries: Yaladai is a powerful stimulant that grants extreme clarity, improving relaxation and focus. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d8}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d8}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Yaladai (Potent)
entries: Yaladai is a powerful stimulant that grants extreme clarity, improving relaxation and focus. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d10}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d10}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Yaladai (Pure)
entries: Yaladai is a powerful stimulant that grants extreme clarity, improving relaxation and focus. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d12}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d12}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Yaladai (Uncut)
entries: Yaladai is a powerful stimulant that grants extreme clarity, improving relaxation and focus. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by {@dice 2d6}. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum force points are reduced by {@dice 2d6}. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Yarrock
entries: Yarrock is a hallucinogen which is said to instill a creature with a clear vision of "the meaning of life", granting a boost to confidence. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional {@dice d3} when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a {@dice d3} and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

spell.name: Absorb Energy

time.condition: which you take when you take acid, cold, energy, fire, ion, kinetic, lightning, or sonic damage

entries: The power captures some of the incoming energy, lessening its effect on you and storing it for your next melee attack. You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Also, the first time you hit with a melee attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the triggering type, and the power ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Acid Dart
entries: A shimmering green dart streaks toward a target within range and bursts in a spray of acid. Make a ranged tech attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d4} acid damage immediately and {@damage 2d4} acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a miss, the dart splashes the target with acid for half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Acid Splash
entries: You emit a burst of acid. Choose one creature within range that you can see, or choose two creatures within range that are within 5 feet of each other that you can see. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} acid damage.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Acid Wind
entries: You produce a breeze full of stinging acid droplets. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d4} acid damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Acidic Strike
entries: As part of the action used to cast this power, you must make a melee weapon attack against one creature within your reach, otherwise the power fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it becomes sheathed in a thick acidic slime until the start of your next turn. Until the start of your next turn, if the target becomes {@condition grappled}, or succeeds in grappling or maintaining a grapple, the slime is pressed into its body, causing it to immediately take {@damage 1d8} acid damage.

This power's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} acid damage to the target, and the damage the target takes for taking grappling or maintaining a grapple increases to {@dice 2d8}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level and 17th level.

spell.name: Adrenaline

time.condition: which you take when a creature within range that you can see would roll initiative

entries: You infuse one creature within range with a jittery burst of power, speeding its senses and reactions to the point of near precognition. The creature makes its initiative check with advantage.

spell.name: Affect Mind
entries: Choose a target within range that isn't hostile toward you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at that target.

On a successful save, the creature does not realize that you tried to use the Force to influence its mood, but it becomes immune to this power for one day. This power has no effect on droids or constructs.

spell.name: Affliction
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Slow|PHB}}}

Choose a creature that you can see within range. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains 1 slowed level, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a power with a casting time of 1 action, roll a {@dice d20}. On an 11 or higher, the power doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the power. If it can't, the power is wasted.
The creatures makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends.

spell.name: Agile Defense
entries: As part of the action of casting this power, you take the {@action Dodge} action.

spell.name: Aid Droid
entries: Choose one droid or construct that you can see within range. The target can immediately use its reaction to regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your techcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Alarm

ends: at the end of your next short or long rest

entries: You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. Until the power ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a Tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area. When you cast the power, you can designate creatures that won't set off the alarm. You also choose whether the alarm is mental or audible.
A silent alarm alerts you with a ping in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the warded area. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.
An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell for 10 seconds within 60 feet.

spell.name: Alter Self
entries: You alter your form with tech. When you cast the power, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the power. While the power lasts, you can end one option as an action to gain the benefits of a different one.

items: {@b {@i Aquatic Adaptation.}} You adapt your body to an aquatic environment. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

{@b {@i Change Appearance.}} You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species (an organic species cannot appear as a droid, or vice versa), though none of your statistics change. You can also alter your vocal cords, enabling you to speak a language you know, but otherwise would be incapable of speaking. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this power to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time for the duration of the power, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

{@b {@i Natural Weapons.}} You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your damage die for your unarmed strikes increases by one step (from 1 to {@dice d4}, {@dice d4} to {@dice d6}, or {@dice d6} to {@dice d8}). Your unarmed strikes are considered enhanced and you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with them.

spell.name: Analyze
entries: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the power. If it is an enhanced or modified item, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any powers are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a power, you learn which power created it.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what tech powers, if any, are currently affecting it.

spell.name: Animate Weapon
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Force Disarm|sw5ephb}}}

You select a light- or vibro-weapon within this power's range that is not worn or carried by a conscious creature other than you, and use the Force to cause it to levitate, acting as an extension of your will for the duration or until you cast this power again. When you use this power, you can cause the weapon to move up to 20 feet and make a melee force attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} + your forcecasting ability modifier damage. The type is of the normal damage dealt by the weapon.

While the weapon is animated, on each of your turns you can use a bonus action to move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. At any time, you can end this force power to return the animated weapon to your hand.

An enemy can attempt to gain control of the weapon by using its action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your force save DC. On a success, the creature gains control of the weapon and the power ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Force Potency
entries: When you cast this power using a force slot of 3rd level or higher, the weapon's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Antipathy/Sympathy
entries: This power attracts or repels creatures of your choice. You target something within range, either a Huge or smaller object or creature or an area that is no larger than a 200-foot cube. Then specify a kind of intelligent creature, such as rancors, kath hounds, or twi'leks. You invest the target with an aura that either attracts or repels the specified creatures for the duration. Choose antipathy or sympathy as the aura's effect.

items: {@b {@i Antipathy.}} The power causes creatures of the kind you designated to feel an intense urge to leave the area and avoid the target. When such a creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened}. The creature remains {@condition frightened} while it can see the target or is within 60 feet of it. While {@condition frightened} by the target, the creature must use its movement to move to the nearest safe spot from which it can't see the target. If the creature moves more than 60 feet from the target and can't see it, the creature is no longer {@condition frightened}, but the creature becomes {@condition frightened} again if it regains sight of the target or moves within 60 feet of it.

{@b {@i Sympathy.}} The power causes the specified creatures to feel an intense urge to approach the target while within 60 feet of it or able to see it. When such a creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or use its movement on each of its turns to enter the area or move within reach of the target. When the creature has done so, it can't willingly move away from the target.

entries: If the target damages or otherwise harms an affected creature, the affected creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to end the effect, as described below.

items: Ending the Effect. If an affected creature ends its turn while not within 60 feet of the target or able to see it, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is no longer affected by the target and recognizes the feeling of repugnance or attraction as unnatural. In addition, a creature affected by the power is allowed another Wisdom saving throw every 24 hours while the power persists.

entries: A creature that successfully saves against this effect is immune to it for 1 minute, after which time it can be affected again.

spell.name: Armor of Abeloth
entries: A protective force surrounds you, manifesting as shimmering light that covers you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Force Potency
entries: When you cast this power using a force slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the psychic damage increase by 5 for each slot.

spell.name: Art of Movement
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Instinctive Movement|null}}}
By letting the Force flow through you, you move with preternatural grace, leaping onto or over tall obstacles that impede others. Until the power ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your speed increases by 10 feet.
You have resistance to damage from falling.
Your jumping distance is tripled.

You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. If you are on a vertical surface when you end your turn and are not using your hands to climb, you immediately fall unless you have some other means of remaining there.
Your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain or squeezing.
You ignore the effects of slowed levels under 3.

entries: Once before the power ends, you can give yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn. That attack deals an extra {@damage 1d10} force damage on a hit. Whether you hit or miss, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of that turn.

spell.name: Assess the Situation
entries: You take a sensory snapshot of a target within range. Your tech grants you a brief insight into the target's defenses. You have advantage on the next attack roll you make against the target before the end of your next turn.
This power benefits additional attacks at higher levels: two attacks at 5th level, three attacks at 11th level, and four attacks at 17th level.

spell.name: Aura of Purity
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Restoration|sw5ephb}}}

Purifying energy radiates from you in a 30-foot radius. Until the power ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) can't become diseased, has resistance to poison damage, and has advantage on saving throws against effects that cause any of the following conditions: {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, and {@condition stunned}.

spell.name: Aura of Vigor
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Valor|sw5ephb}}}

Envigorating energy radiates from you in a 30-foot radius. Until the power ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage with weapon attacks.

spell.name: Autonomous Servant

ends: at the end of your next short or long rest

entries: You touch one Tiny, unenhanced object that isn't attached to another object or a surface and isn't being carried by another creature. The target animates and gains little arms and legs, becoming a creature under your control until the power ends or the creature drops to 0 hit points. See the stat block for its statistics.

As a bonus action, you can nonverbally command the creature if it is within 120 feet of you. (If you control multiple creatures with this power, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a simple, general command, such as to fetch a {@item Code Cylinder|sw5ephb|code cylinder}, stand watch, or stack some small objects. If you issue no commands, the servant does nothing other than defend itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the servant continues to follow that order until its task is complete.
When the creature drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original form, and any remaining damage carries over to that form.
The creature is considered a valid target for the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5ephb} power.
{@creature autonomous servant|sw5ephb}

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 4th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Bacta Pack
entries: You create a luminescent pack of bacta in any space, occupied or unoccupied, within range. The pack remains in its space until it is activated by any creature you choose. If the space you choose is occupied by a creature you have designated, it can use its reaction to immediately activate the pack; otherwise, a creature within 5 feet of the pack can use a bonus action to touch it and activate it.

When the pack is activated by a designated creature, that creature regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your techcasting ability modifier, and the pack is consumed. If the power ends before the pack has been activated, it becomes useless and disintegrates. This power has no effect on droids or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 2nd level or higher, you may either increase the healing of a single pack by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st, or create another pack in a separate space, with one additional pack for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ballistic Shield
entries: A flickering blue shield surrounds your body. Until the power ends, you have resistance to kinetic, energy, and ion damage.

spell.name: Barrage
entries: You launch {@dice 4d6} tiny projectiles at up to four creatures you can see within range. The projectiles can be divided between the targets as desired. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 1 kinetic damage per projectile, or half as much damage on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 2nd level or higher, you launch an additional {@dice 1d6} projectiles and can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Battle Insight
entries: You center your focus on a target within range. Through the Force, you gain a brief insight into the target's defenses. On your next turn, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against the target, provided that this power hasn't ended.
This power benefits additional attacks at higher levels: two attacks at 5th level, three attacks at 11th level, and four attacks at 17th level.

spell.name: Battle Meditation
entries: You exude an aura out to 5 feet that boosts the morale and overall battle prowess of you and your allies while simultaneously reducing the opposition's combat-effectiveness by eroding their will to fight.
Whenever you or a friendly creature within your meditation makes an attack roll or a saving throw, they can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Whenever a hostile creature enters your meditation or starts its turn there, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from each attack roll or saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn. On a successful save, it is immune to this power for 1 day.

spell.name: Battle Precognition
entries: Your attunement to the Force warns you when you are about to enter danger. Until the power ends, your base AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier. This power has no effect if you are wearing armor.

spell.name: Battlemind
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Battle Precognition|sw5ephb}}}

Through the Force, you gain a limited form of telepathy that enables you to anticipate the moves of your opponents in combat. While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield, you gain a +2 AC bonus against melee attacks and a +3 AC bonus against ranged attacks.
This AC bonus is not applied against attacks from droids, constructs, or creatures with resistance or immunity to psychic damage.

spell.name: Beacon of Hope
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Heroism|PHB}}}

This power bestows hope and vitality. Choose any number of creatures within range. For the duration, each target has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

spell.name: Beast Trick
entries: This power lets you distract a beast. Choose a beast that you can see within range. If the beast's Intelligence is 4 or higher, the power fails. Otherwise, the beast must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for the power's duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the power ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Force Potency
entries: When you cast this power using a force slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional beast for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Bestow Curse
entries: {@b {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Curse|sw5ephb}}}

You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the power. When you cast this power, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

items: Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. lf it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
While the target is cursed, your attacks and powers deal an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to the target.

entries: A remove curse power ends this effect. At the GM's discretion, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The GM has final say on such a curse's effect. This power has no effect on droids or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Force Potency
entries: If you cast this power using a force slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a force slot of 5th Level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a force slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level force slot, the power lasts until it is dispelled. Using a force slot of 5th Level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Bestow Virus
entries: You touch a droid, construct, or a creature with a tech focus, and it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or receive a tech-based curse for the duration of the power. When you cast this power, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

items: Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
While cursed, the target must make an Intelligence saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
While the target is cursed, your attacks and powers deal an extra {@damage 1d8} lightning damage to the target.

entries: A *remove virus* power ends this effect. At the GM's discretion, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The GM has final say on such a curse's effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: If you cast this power using a tech slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a tech slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a tech slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th-level tech slot, the power lasts until it is dispelled. Using a tech slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Break
entries: You inflict 10 force damage to an object you can see within range that is not being worn or carried, generating an explosion of sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Even if the object is not destroyed, small shards of shrapnel fly at creatures within 5 feet of it. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d4} kinetic damage.

This power's kinetic damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}), and the power's force damage also increases by 10 at each of these levels.

spell.name: Breath Control
entries: You are able to slow your metabolism in such a way that you can stop breathing and resist the effect of toxins in your body. If you are {@condition poisoned}, you neutralize the poison. If more than one poison afflicts you, you neutralize one poison that you know is present, or you neutralize one at random.
For the duration, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, resistance to poison damage, and you no longer need to breathe.

spell.name: Buffer
entries: You gain {@dice 1d4 + 4} temporary hit points for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Burst
entries: You cause the earth to burst from beneath your feet. Each creature within range, other than you, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} kinetic damage.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Burst of Flame
entries: You expel a burst of flame in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide, originating from you. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Overcharge Tech
entries: When you cast this power using a tech slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Burst of Speed
entries: You touch a creature. The target's speed increases by 10 feet until the power ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Force Potency
entries: When you cast this power using a force slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cage
entries: An immobile, {@condition invisible}, cube-shaped prison composed of energy springs into existence around an area you choose within range. The prison can be a cage or a solid box as you choose.
A prison in the shape of a cage can be up to 20 feet on a side and is made from 1/2-inch diameter bars spaced 1/2 inch apart.
A prison in the shape of a box can be up to 10 feet on a side, creating a solid barrier that prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking any powers cast into or out of the area.

When you cast the power, any creature that is completely inside the cage's area is trapped. Creatures only partially within the area, or those too large to fit inside the area, are pushed away from the center of the area until they are completely outside the area.

A creature inside the cage can't leave it by unenhanced means. If the creature tries to teleport to leave the cage, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature can use that power to exit the cage. On a failure, the creature can't exit the cage and wastes the use of the power or effect.
This power can't be dispelled.

spell.name: Call Lightning
